reviews.title: Love the texture!!
reviews.review_text: I recently added the Better Homes %26 Gardens 9.8‚Äù White Handled Ceramic Vase to my formal dining table, and it's such a beautiful piece. The texture and matte white color give it a clean, elegant look that fits perfectly with my decor. It looks much more high-end than the price suggests! I especially love the subtle detailing and the handles ‚Äî they give the vase a timeless, slightly rustic feel that works in both modern and traditional settings. My only wish is that it came in a larger size, especially for use as a centerpiece on bigger tables. Still, it's a lovely accent piece and a great value. I'd definitely buy it again or grab another if they release a taller version.
I Love the vase very much. The color and height goes well with my other decorations on top of my dresser. It can go alone or with some twigs or flower arrangements.

reviews.title: Absolutely love it, beautiful and quality
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Really nice sleek and strong design. Really well made, doesn't look at or feel at all cheap. Has a good weight for the size and fits perfectly on my hutch in my dining area. Planning on adding some eucalyptus to it

reviews.title: Perfect decor piece!
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love how sturdy this vase is and the multiple handle design. It has enough room inside to fit multiple types of flowers and deep enough to hold enough water. The white color is very elegant and stands out in any room. It is easy to clean and stores upright in any cabinet. It is a unique design that definitely added a unique touch to my kitchen dining area.

reviews.title: Versatile style and amazing quality
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The vase is beautiful and an amazing quality product. The design is so versatile and could be designed to go with modern or farmhouse rustic styles with the addition of some flowers and leaves inside. The size is great to fit on any table or even a fireplace mantel.

reviews.title: Beautifully Crafted Vase
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This vase is so beautiful! I was surprised at how heavy this weighed - it felt like a luxurious home decor item. The texture is of this feels like a handmade ceramic product with little bumps and edges that give it a character. This would need a lot of flowers to make it look full as the mouth of this is pretty wide. This stands at a nice height of 10 inches and would make a pretty piece in the middle of a dining table or as a living room decor on a table. I also like this isn't straight up white, but more of an ivory color, which fits my house neutral color aesthetic.

reviews.title: 3 handle vase
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I received this product free from Influenster for my honest opinion. I received the Bettrr Homes & Gardens 9.8" White handled Ceramic Vase. I love how sturdy this is. It has a nice textured finish. The three handles come in handy when you have a full vase.

reviews.title: The perfect entryway staple!
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The perfect vase for our entryway! I can't wait to fill it with the perfect greenery. In love with the simplicity of it. It came packaged perfectly, so there were no knicks/ cracks. Highly recommend!

reviews.title: Elegant and Versatile a stunning statement Vase
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was gifted the Better Homes & Gardens 3-Handle White Vase by Better Homes & Gardens and an influencer,in exchange for my honest opinion,and I must say I am so impressed! The design is simple yet striking, with the three-handle detail adding a unique, sculptural touch. The matte white finish makes it super versatile‚Äîit just fits seamlessly into any decor style, whether modern, boho, or classic. It's the perfect size for fresh or dried flowers, but honestly, it's a statement piece on its own. The quality is excellent, and it feels much more expensive than it is. Such a beautiful addition to my home!

reviews.title: Stunning!
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Absolutely stunning vase! It feels very high quality and I love that there's non slips on the bottom so the vase won't slide around. It will look beautiful with or without flowers in it too!

reviews.title: Simple and lovely

Great fabric, they are lightweight and more comfortable than blue jeans, which is great, with the heat we experience in the south. Another plus, is that they look nice. My husband likes them enough that he asked for more, in different colors; blue or camo.

reviews.title: I buy these cargos again and again.
reviews.review_text: These light weight cargos are a stable for me during the summer. Frankly, most of spring and fall also. Mosquitos can be fierce in my area so I wear them every day on my walks, to cookouts and and hanging out on the patio with friends. Shorts would be nice, but long comfortable light pants save me from bites. The only problem is a wear them out on the inside legs walking a couple miles every day. Fortunately, the reasonable price makes them easy to replace. The only possible improvement would be if there was away to reinforce that inside inside legs area for better wear.

reviews.title: Breakfast All Starversatile, nice to wear, durablx
reviews.review_text: Rugged enough for work, still comfortable to wear. Durable over time, so much so that I've bought more. Nice enough for semi-dressy use, great with work shirts, great with a t-shirt or sweatshirt too.

reviews.review_text: Bought these for comfort, long pants but not to hot in very hot locations. Plus more secure - ish pockets for my phone and other items. Unfortunately the back pockets don't have the velcro flap or even a button for closure. But still more pocket space than ordinary jeans, and light weight fabric will help after the hustle-bustle makes you sweat. One suggestion, please add more colors! Esp cream, light or faded blue and /or green.

reviews.title: Not again

I bought 4 pair of Wranglers and 3 fit perfect and the ripstop pair was about 2 inches small in the waist. They wanted to charge me return shipping for the small pair. No more Wranglers for me.

the cargo pants you use to sell, ( which is all I buy and wear from Walmart) is a joke..looks good, but real thin material compared to thicker more sturdy material before..and it doesn't last as long and you charge more money for cheaper product. reviews.title: Great pair of cargo pants
reviews.review_text: The side pockets with the flaps are big enough to hold my big cell phone, that is great. All the pockets are big and roomy, and the fit for me is great. For the price you can't get a better pair of pants. The material seems soft and much nicer than denim jeans.

reviews.title: Good work pants for industrial enviroment
reviews.review_text: I use these at work as an equipment operator at a nuclear power plant. The open top pocket on the left leg is perfectly sized for the wireless phones that we use in the plants. Black does hide grease a bit better than the tan ones, however I do find that my fluffy white cat is attracted more to these pants than my other ones. Cargo pockets have pleats, so they will fit more than just something flat. 2 "extra" belt loops help quite a bit with extra equipment on the belt (pager, radio, keys, multi-tool, etc). Pants look best if taken out of the dryer warm and not too dry (use the energy efficiency setting) and then hung, or pressed; they are a bit prone to getting wrinkled if allowed to cool and dry in a pile. After a wash or two, leg pockets will not be flat unless they are pressed.

reviews.title: Excellent choice for men at work, hobby shop, etc.
reviews.review_text: The leg pockets allow for keeping needed items handy. My husband is glad that the back pockets do not have annoying flaps or buttons. The fabric is sturdy, but not heavy to wear. The size seems to be accurate and roomy making bending and movements easy to do. However, it would be good to have these available with more length options. My husband needs a 31" length. These pants only come in 30" and 32" lengths. So, the pants need to be hemmed in order to get an appropriate length for him. He has been wearing these pants for about 5 years and is very satisfied with how well and long they last.

reviews.title: Sized different or mismarked
reviews.review_text: I wear 34x34 in Wrangler Premium flex fit cargo pants. I ordered two of navy and they are extremely tight in waist. I had already removed tags from one pair. I'd return both if wasn't for that reason. Either marked wrong size or huge difference in this make than others of same brand.

reviews.title: Durable, comfortable and flexible
reviews.review_text: I get 4 to 5 years of of these wearing them 3 days a week, waking then every second week unless they get sorry or stained. They have some small stretch and I find them very comfortable. Temperatures from 0 to 85 degrees f. and still maintain a good comfortable temperature.

reviews.title: Too long
reviews.review_text: For years I've been buying this idem. Size 36, 32. They have always fit great. This time I needed 38, 32. Looks like when you go up in waist size, the length is incorrect. These paints are in fact, 33 inches long. One inch longer than all the pants I've been buying thoughtout the years.

reviews.title: Amazing Value! Another Successful Purchase!
reviews.review_text: These pants are excellent at twice the price. Shirts, underwear, socks, shoes are easy for me to purchase online. Sizes are accurate ninety eight percent of the time. Pants sizes are always off. I purchase pants in a physical store. These Wrangler cargo pants are the exception. I unpack them, wash them and hang them up. I do not need to try them on. This is my third time purchasing Wrangler cargo pants online. Never a problem. If there was one, I am confident that Walmart would correct it. These pants feel and look good. Do not be afraid to try them.

reviews.title: Fantastic Pants
reviews.review_text: I found my first pair of rip stop cargo pants about a year ago and now they are about the only pair of pants I wear anymore. They are so comfortable and the fit is great. It's great having all of the pockets and my phone is great in the phone pocket on the left side of the pants. These pants are so great I have 7 pairs in the 3 different colors. PLEASE DON'T STOP MAKING THESE PANTS!

reviews.title: Better than 5.11 Tactical Pants
reviews.review_text: I work in law enforcement and have purchased both these cargo pants and the 5.11 tactical pants. The 5.11 pants shrunk after 1 wash. These pants have held up. They are way more comfortable to wear than the 5.11 and the price below $20 compared to $50 and up was a no brainer in making the purchase.

reviews.title: better than jeans
reviews.review_text: Last year I ordered Wrangler - Men's Rip-Stop Cargo Pants in Khaki and got to like them very much, especially the lightness of the fabric weight. I live in south Florida, mostly wear shorts, but when I wear long pants e.g. jeans, they are just too heavy. Since I couldn't find Rip-Stop Cargo Pants in black I went with these pants. When I first got them I thought the weight felt similar to my jeans but after one washing then wearing I think they are thin enough. I like the pocket layout especially the side leg pockets so I don't have to carry my wallet in the back pocket for comfort and ease of access.

reviews.title: What Happened To Wrangler Quality
reviews.review_text: I have come to realize that the Wrangler name no longer means quality control. If the lesser price items aren't as important as the more expensive ones, then there is no quality control. Never know what the true size will be until the pants go into the laundry. Sometimes the waist is what I ordered and sometimes not even close.

reviews.title: Best cargo pants
reviews.review_text: My husband loves these cargo pants. It is basicly the best because the fit is great plus it has the velco flaps on the cargo pockets and best of all it has no flaps on the back pockets, which is what he was looking for. I take them right out of the dryer and no ironing. The fit is true to size.

Hard to rate the rip stop cargo pants from Wrangler when they didn't size them correctly. I ordered 36x34 and they were too short. I checked, and the inseam measured 32 inches. One inch I probably could have dealt with it, but 2 inches, no way. I am not faulting Walmart, they didn't mislabel these pants, Wrangler did.

reviews.title: I love these pants
reviews.review_text: In the last 8 years I've owned 15 pair of these. Right now I have 7 pair that I wear constantly. These are the most comfortable pants I have ever worn, and don't plan on switching anytime soon. They fit perfect, and the amount/positioning of the pockets is exactly what I need. Plenty of room to bend and squat without cutting off blood flow to my extremities. I do a lot of wood working and usually wind up covered in saw dust, but a quick brush off and the pants look good as new (which is more than I can say about my hair or shirts in that situation).

reviews.title: On the thinner side
reviews.review_text: I have worn these for a number of years and the material keeps getting thinner and thinner. The quality stitching and construction is the same, however. Also the waist line in the newer ones appears to be tighter even though I have lost weight and my older pants are now fitting more loosely. I would consider going up a size if I buy them again.

reviews.title: Their pants should be your pants. But some.
reviews.review_text: Theyre solid cargos and the cell phone pocket is brilliant. One observation, the are slightly off from one pair to the next. All the same size (I have 3 for work) but each fits a little different and the inseam is inconsistent. Not bad just noticeably different. Otherwise perfect work/outdoor pants.

reviews.title: I will always buy these pants
reviews.review_text: These cargo pants are seriously the only pants my son will wear. The have a great fit, the material is durable and they hold up wash after wash. The black color of his pants has not faded, even after a year of wear. I hope the never stop selling them.

reviews.title: Very good pants!
reviews.review_text: What can I say - they're pants! They fit well, and are very comfortable. The best part is - - they come in my length!! Most pants don't come less than 30in. length, and these do! Need to come out with some exactly like these, except in rip-stop polyester. That would be great! I use these pants for work in Security. Also, it would be nice to have both cargo pockets with the pocket behind, for phone, billfold, etc. The best pants I've bought in a l-o-n-g time. Thank you Wrangler, and thank you Wal Mart!

reviews.title: My husband loves these pant
reviews.review_text: My husband wears these everywhere and when they get that worn out look after wearing so much, he wears them to work. They wash well, dry fast and hold up for a long time. I do wish they had come in the green color they used to have last year. That was his favorite.

reviews.title: Heavier Material, Good Fit
reviews.review_text: I like that these cargo pants are not "relaxed fit", like those that flood the shelves in most Walmart stores. I don't want to look all that "relaxed" all the time, but rather, somewhat well-dressed. Sizing was perfect for me. These pants are well-made of a heavier material than most Wrangler Cargo pants I have. A little warm for summer, but nice even then when the restaurant or bar you are in have their thermostat set on "August", or whatever it is that makes those places too cold to enjoy in the same clothes in which you came from the outdoors. Unlike other cargo pants I have, these have only the one slit pocket for a smart phone (it's on the left side), rather than one on each side, just in case that matters to you. A plus is that these pants come in odd-numbered waist sizes. I wanted a 31"-inch waist (not a 30 or a 32), and that's what I got. And they fit perfectly.

reviews.title: Overall good but a little tight
reviews.review_text: It was tighter than expected. The next one I order will be one size up. I do like the cargo pockets. One of the cargo pockets has an additional built in pocket that you don't have to open the flap. Quite handy for a cell phone. The material is good quality. I use it at a fast food restaurant where it gets messy but stains come out easily. No rips in the material. Slightly annoying is that there are too many belt loops.

reviews.title: Sized really small
reviews.review_text: I recently bought a pair of jean of another brand with a 34 waist. They fit well, maybe even slightly loose in the waist. These Wrangler cargo pants (not jeans) are also supposedly 34's, but they are considerably smaller in the waist. They fit me very tight. It's difficult to tell much else about them, because I can't wear them. Since I'm in the process of losing weight, I'll hold onto them for a couple of weeks to see if I can get down to their size. They are also very stiff, at least they way they come from the factory. I suspect it's a lot of "sizing" that will wash out, but I can't be sure, because they fit so badly that I don't want to wash them and then not be able to return them. All in all, this was not a very satisfactory purchase.

reviews.title: More options needed
reviews.review_text: The cargo pants were supplied as stated in description. I am 5' 8" with 36 waist and 28" inseam. It seems that the inseam always goes to the PLUS size in length. I ordered the 36 x 29 as it is closest to my needs. It always becomes necessary for me to have them shortened or they will drag under the heel. After the additional expense, its not a great deal but I like the product. I have been a Wrangler patron for almost 54 years. No follow-up contact is needed as I am sure the demographics of my needed size do not merit more sku's. Just took the trouble to express frustrations. Thank you

reviews.title: Good pants ruined by poor re-design of pocket area!
reviews.review_text: I have been wearing these (70LEWGL) cargo pants for years - they're my favorite pants. Or they WERE until someone decided to re-design the front pocket area! Now these dark camo pants are ruined by an over-exposed white pocket area that used to be recessed into the front pocket by more than an inch. Now the fabric overlap is barely 1/2 an inch. PLEASE REVERT BACK TO THE ORIGINAL DESIGN - PLEASE!!!

reviews.title: Excellent durability pockets and versatility !
reviews.review_text: Excellent structure stitching and form. Perfectly sized. Fades too fast even in cold water. Have worn this style for 10 years running, more than 60 pair of pants. Perfect pocket for holding the Sword of the Spirit, that is the timeless Word of GOD, and durable enough for exploring HIS vast rewards from sea to mountain to fall and fountain. HalleluYAHWEH!!! Thanks be to GOD for your gifts. Blessings in Jesus Name. Love you all.

reviews.title: Wrangler - Men's Cargo Pants
reviews.review_text: These are great khaki cargo pants. I'm a big cargo jeans fan, and I used to buy these at my local Walmart. When they stopped carrying them there, I began buying them online. The fit is perfect. I like the fact that they include a "Tech Pocket" within the cargo pocket on one of the legs for my cell phone. This last time around, I bought four pairs in various styles - two bluejeans, one khaki, and one rip stop green.
i BOUGHT THE SAME SIZE AS TWO OTHERS THAT I HAD PURCHASED BUT THERE WERE ABOUT 4 INCHES SHORT AROUND THE WAIST.
My husband use them for work, and he likes the fit, and that their soft material, he will be purchasing more for work

reviews.title: Best Pants Ever!!
reviews.review_text: Great Pants ! I'm a teacher and they look like business casual but are tough and functional! Great pants for everyday !

reviews.title: Comfortable pants to work in
reviews.review_text: These pants are very comfortable and they run a little loose which was great for my leg room. I'm using these for work and so far they seem to be holding up.

These are kind of light duty work pants. Tend to wrinkle up some. One pair had trouble with the fly zipper working right. They are pretty comfy tho. Good light work pants. Over all....4 out of 5 stars

reviews.title: Horrible
reviews.review_text: First time my husband wore this the belt loop broke they lasted a week then both knees ripped open with knee pads on! He is a roofer, as for comfortable pants they are great, same for price. Cheaply made unfortunately.
Li lighter weight than I expected But I'm not disappointed they're very good for the mild weather and extra comfortable and lower weight on hikes is obviously good

reviews.title: Great pants
reviews.review_text: These pants were great and were true to their size. The only issue is the specific material attracts a lot of fuzzy lint and hair until they're washed a few times.

These Wrangler Cargo Pants are nice, but a little more lightweight than expected. I wish Wrangler offered a cargo pant with a little more polyester content to help with less wrinkling and more durability.
These black pants are great! They fit nice and the fabric is soft. I would definitely recommend them.

reviews.title: Great deal
reviews.review_text: Being a new company was looking for quality at a price we could afford and we found it with Wrangler. Our technicians wear these, they hold up to the job, they keep from fading, look good on my techs, and over all a superior product.

reviews.title: Great lightweight jeans.
reviews.review_text: Light weight and cool. Relaxed fit for larger men. Does not wrinkle. Onle complaint is that they are stocked by very few Walmarts, though they can be purchased on line.

reviews.title: Smaller than label
reviews.review_text: I've bought several pairs prior to COVID and had no problems. The last pair I bought last year was two or three sizes smaller than the size they are labeled.

reviews.title: Great Pants
reviews.review_text: These are well-made, comfortable casual pants at a great price. My son has worn them for years (the pockets really come in handy when traveling). I just wish he could find his size in more colors.

reviews.title: Great pants for us big guys!!
reviews.review_text: I've tried many other brands of cargo pants from other stores, and the fit is not loose enough. These have a loose fit for those of us with a large behind! Great pants. After I bought a pair in the store, I ordered two more online!

reviews.title: Great pants, but wrinkle easily
reviews.review_text: These pants are great for my son's new job, and look great...as long as you don't mind ironing them...they wrinkle very easily, but really like them and wash well.

reviews.title: The larger guy uses the mail order buying a pig in
reviews.review_text: Not as the black ones I bought. These are tight but they work for me. Too bad you cant find the size on the shelf at the store. Just the skinny folks get the selection.
item fits very well, but in my line of work the belt loops tear easily. I use a utility belt, is a wide belt and puts a lot of stress on the belt loops.

reviews.title: Good Buy
reviews.review_text: i like cargo pants and these fit pretty good even though they are mans pants I wish the length came in 29 cause the 30 is to long on these for some reason..

reviews.title: Dockers
reviews.review_text: They are very comfortable and they got cell phone pocket (why I purchase them). I drive for a leaving and they hold up under constant get in and out of the cab. Wish the came in more colors and length

reviews.title: cargo pants
reviews.review_text: My only problem is why they can't have this pair of pants in the store. They want everyone to shop local but how when the only cater to the tiny and petite people. they have no clothes in the store for the larger people.

The quality and price are incredible. But they do run small. I wear jeans size 38 or 40 depending on the brand. I ordered a size 40 for these and they were tight, I would recommend to get one size up.

reviews.title: Very poor quality
reviews.review_text: These pants are not what they were. They were a nice heavy twill. These I just got are a very thin cotton. One pair the fabric ripped at the button, another pair ripped at the pocket. Don‚Äôt waste your money.

reviews.title: Great Pants
reviews.review_text: Great Value! Can not find similar pants at Kohls or JC Penney. Big and Tall shop is 2x the price. Wal-Mart shipped freaky fast on this order. 3 days or less!

reviews.title: Claustrophobic
reviews.review_text: The pants are nice but trying to get in and out of a vehicle while wearing them make them TERRIBLE. They restrict movement and give me anxiety like I'm being confined to a small compartment. I do not recommend getting these at all

I had previously purchased this same exact pant in the size 30. Thinking that it would be the same, I bought it online and it fit so snug I can't even button it up. Same size and same style yet the other one does not fit‚Ä¶

reviews.title: Good Product, Good Price
reviews.review_text: I have bought these pants at a retailer before and will continue to purchase and wear Wrangler cargo pants. They are a great product and a great value.

reviews.title: great fit and comfortable pant
reviews.review_text: Surprisingly well built, heavy fabric and a nice baggy cut. The way cargo pants ought to be made, and a nice find amongst other, less quality offerings.
i ordered 46x32 46x32 46x32 and i recieved 3 36x34 this was for work and now im stuck with the wrong clothes that was due to arriver june 19 so disappointed

reviews.title: Best pants you can get for the money.
reviews.review_text: I have now bought eight pair of these over the last five years, I am retired I wear them every single day. They are comfortable durable and have good pockets. I hope they never stop making them. And the price is outstanding.
My husband loves the fit and comfort of these pants for work in the heat. The fabric of these cargo pants are lightweight and have velcro pockets to secure his cellphone and wallet.

reviews.title: Overall a nice field work pant
reviews.review_text: I use these in my construction business. Color is definitely on the grayer side of green. I like the flat style cargo pockets and the left pocket has a special space for a mobile device.

reviews.title: Green KHaki
reviews.review_text: I've bought numerous pairs of the ripstop cargo pants and like their fit and durability. The description calls them khaki color. They are a pale olive green not khaki which is tan. But they are a good value. Relatively inexpensive and durable.

reviews.title: They used to be so much better.
reviews.review_text: Wrangler's last two versions of this item are horribly lacking. A few years ago, the fabric was durable. Then they switched to a thinner stretchy material, which was so weak that catching the cargo pocket on the arm of a chair would cause the side to rip open. the latest batch I bought was back to what I tight was the durable material, but I was sadly disappointed to have a pair rip the same way when I arrived at work.

the first pair of Wranglers cargo pants i got were a 38 and they were a little to big but i got these in a 36 and well if ibdry them to much on high heat they are not going to fit, lets just say this i dont need a belt like the 38s will slip down some but not these

Ok, so, these are the only pants my husband will wear, so they must be comfortable. The fabric seems ok, but having been buying these exact same pants for 10 years, I have to say the overall quality has gone down. When I first started buying them, 3 pairs reliably lasted my husband a full year. It was like clockwork. Every year, I'd pick him up 3 pairs at tax time, and by the time it rolled around again, they were getting holes or losing buttons, and I'd replace them. In the last few years, things like losing buttons and ripping/unravelling seams have meant that instead of once a year, I'm buying them like three times a year. They're still the only pants my husband will wear, though, so I'm still buying them, and the price isn't bad, especially if you catch them on sale. I just miss the days when I only had to think about my husband's pants once a year!

reviews.title: size was off by 1 or 2 sizes
reviews.review_text: These cargo pants were probably 2 sizes smaller than what they were marked as. These pants don't have the elastic that the other cargo pants I've gotten from Wrangler, so maybe it's only 1 size off, but I was nowhere close to being able to fasten these

Hey, so I'm a first responder, and I ordered something on October 30th. They said I could pick it up, but then they told me it wasn't ready and would be delivered by 5:30 that day. I got a bunch of notifications, and the last one said it would be delivered at 2 am on October 31st. I even texted my driver, Zyasia, multiple times, but she didn't respond. Now I don't have the item I need for work today, and I'm going to be late. Walmart really needs to be honest with their customers about when stuff is available because I could have just bought it from Amazon or Target for a few bucks more.

reviews.title: Verified purchaser
reviews.review_text: Truthfully the quality of wrangler has taken a downward spiral from as recent as five years ago. Just like everything else, the price goes up and the quality goes down. I do like the pants, although the end scene runs just a little long otherwise they are as advertised.

reviews.title: Excellent Value for The Money
reviews.review_text: They fit a little tight at the waist, running slightly smaller than actual size, but if I'd gotten 1 size larger, they'd be too big. The fabric is slightly more coarse than some brands, but I imagine they'll soften up after a few washes. I'm a little disappointed that the cargo pockets didn't have button enclosure instead of velcro, as velcro always wears out quicker. Other than that, I'm happy with them.

reviews.title: My go to pants
reviews.review_text: My go to pants for six years now. I buy them in bulk (10 pair) when they wear out, in about five-six years. I just made another bulk purchase and was delighted to know they were actually cheaper than they were six years ago! I buy them in a larger size because they will shrink a little. I'm a 36w and I buy 38w, after a wash they fit great.

reviews.title: Frustrated with your lies about shipping.
reviews.review_text: My complaint is with your shipping lies. Everything I order tells me 3 day shipping but I have yet to ever receive dive one in less than a week. These are Christmas presents and ours is on 12:21/24. I have another order that said 3 days shipping so I ordered them. Guess what it has not even left whatever country it's coming from. I AM VERY FRUSTRATED WITH YA'LL WALMART. I will order in future from Amazon. They get the shipping as they tell you if 2 days you can bet you will get in 2 days not a week.

Great great deal on these cargos and my husband loves them! They're comfortable, have lots of leg room, and I appreciate the different lengths they have. My husband is on the shorter side and I was surprised that they have a 28 inch inseam. Great find!

I ordered these pants 2 times. I hate these pants. They keep sending me Relaxed Fit . Relaxed Fit is to large for me. They make the rear of the pants to large and the upper legs to large. I am going to have to return this order because of the relaxed fit. I hate having to return stuff it is a drag.
The pants are very nice and comfy for work nice flexible

reviews.title: Good pants
reviews.review_text: I like these, but the waist was slightly tight compared to the other 36" pants I bought. Still good

reviews.title: yes
reviews.review_text: Leg length just a little bit shorter than another Wrangler product of the same size.

reviews.title: I love the cargo pants!
reviews.review_text: I love the fit. The pockets are very handy for cell phone.
Fits and feels great use the for outdoors camping and fishing

reviews.title: Pay attention to your orders!
reviews.review_text: I was totally amazed that you put the order through, I had cancelled the order seconds after I placed it you sent me a notice you received my cancellation! When I received the product it was the wrong size and wrong color, that was the last online order youll receive from me!and Ill be returning these to the store for a refund!

reviews.title: Dissappointing - Not your father's Wranglers.
reviews.review_text: I bought 2 pair of these 5 years ago, and they are STILL my favorite work pants. I just bought 2 new pair last week. These have the exact same garment style number on the tag, but they are NOT THE SAME PANTS!!! These are made from MUCH THINNER cotton, and feel like they will wear out quickly. The belt loops feel like they're ready to tear off. Even the pocket liners are thinner material than my 5 year old pants. They are also cut differently. The waistband comes up about 2 inches lower than the old ones before they start grabbing my crotch. Also, the old ones were made in Mexico, these come from Bangladesh. SHAME ON YOU WRANGLER!!!

reviews.title: Light-weight, active pants
reviews.review_text: It was great to find these pants online, they had been discontinued at the store. Walmart had other styles similar but not the same material. The rip-stop cotton material is great for outdoor activities such as hiking, fishing, hunting or just working outside in the yard.

reviews.title: Good Pants, Nice Price
reviews.review_text: I bought this same style of pant about 5 months ago. I liked the fit and got compliments on them. Through my own fault, I tore a whole in the pants. I was happy to be able to replace them without shelling out a lot of money. This time, I bought a pair in black and one in khaki. I'm happy with both. I am also glad that Walmart offers these pants in 30 W by 30 L. Short folks need pants too. I'd like to see the pants offered in 30 W by 29 L.

reviews.title: Not what they used to be.
reviews.review_text: I've purchased these pants in the past. The actual cloth being used, now, is thin, more like a dress pant. The older version, the cloth was thicker, making the pant more "rugged". I had to put these aside for "work", and buy Dickies which aren't available from WM. The pants are "nice", therefore the "3" rating, but they're not the same pant WM was selling months ago.

reviews.title: Confused! Weird fitments
reviews.review_text: I'm confused as I got 3 pairs of these in total from Walmart, same location, brand, and fit, all of them are relaxed fit that I got. One is 32 in hips, one is 34 and one is 36. The 34 is bigger then the 36. I can pull it off my hips and have 5 inches to spare. But the 36 for some reason is the same is able to give 3 inches to spare on the hips. Now a 32...it won't pull up past my knees!? Did it come in child size? I don't understand what the heck happened. None of the sizes actually fit.

I have ordered these pants in the past many times no issues. But now I cannot get the appropriate size mailed to me. I have ordered them twice in the last month both times they have come with the right size tag on them but they are not the correct size.. I ordered 34 /30 first time you guys sent them out it had to be a 30-34. I ordered them again and you sent me probably a 32-30...‚ÄçÔ∏è‚ÄçÔ∏è‚ÄçÔ∏è‚ÄçÔ∏è‚ÄçÔ∏è‚ÄçÔ∏è‚ÄçÔ∏è

reviews.title: Good buy
reviews.review_text: Great for working construction. If you are wearing a harness a lot at work, I recommend getting work out spandex type shorts to go under. These are great for Horse back riding. Hiking. I buy them big enough to pull over a warm layer. The rip stop is a better buy if you can get them but the cotton are good ones. Cottons will shrink some in length over several washes. Overall its a really good buy for the money.

reviews.title: Not Authentic. Not Comfortable.
reviews.review_text: New pants did not fit correctly. I have been wearing Wrangler cargo pants as part of my work uniform for over a decade. Very disappointed to discover these are made with a lighter-weight fabric and cut with significantly less fabric through the seat and thigh. They pull up at the rise which makes the pockets flare open, and fit so snugly that when I crouch down they strain at the seams. I was disappointed but not surprised to see the label is also different. The ones I like are "authentic," these are not. I will be returning these tonight.

reviews.title: Poor fitting Legacy Cargo Pants
reviews.review_text: I already have 3 pairs of these and love them. However, this lastest pair I purchased is absolutely not sized correctly. They measure as a 36 waist but marked as a 38, which is what I ordered. Unfortunately I washed them which only got worse. I should return but I've decided not to purchase anymore of these. I will switch to Amazon for clothing purchases from now on...

reviews.title: Excellent Everyday & Travel Pants
reviews.review_text: I've been buying /wearing these Wranglers for a long time. They are consistently a great product - whether for everyday use or especially as travel pants in non-hot climates. They are of course heavier than super light travel pants but thats what you want unless you're going to the tropics. They wear and wash well and come out of the dryer ready to go. A bit of touch up ironing on the cargo pocket flaps before you hit the airport is usually a good idea but not required.

reviews.title: comfortable when cautious
reviews.review_text: the open pocket for the cell phone isn't deep enough to keep the phone in while driving a stick shift it slips out and ends up on the floor or between the seat and the drivers door but I like the pants in general and so don't use the open pocket when driving my truck.
I haven't received the product.Its concerning to me that one entity doesn't no what the other is doing or not doing

reviews.title: really nice fit but no stretch
reviews.review_text: nice fit. I wish the material had just a little bit of stretch. These look great. They are well made and I would definitely buy these again.

reviews.title: Good fit traditional 100% cotton Men's Cargo
reviews.review_text: The fit is as expected. None of the sissy stuff like tapered legs or low waist, not stretchy. I like them and I like the darker tan color

reviews.title: Ripstop my muse
reviews.review_text: Wears like iron but feels soft and comfy

reviews.title: Wranglers
reviews.review_text: my son loves these, wish there were taller options but glad I could order on here
I like Wrangler Cargo Pants. I miss cargoes with buttons, but velcro is good enough.

reviews.title: I ordered the wrong size and cut off the tags.
reviews.review_text: Wish I could have returned it. Oh, well. Can't say it was wonderful. Gave the pants away.

reviews.title: Wrangler quality
reviews.review_text: wrangler brand products are always good.These pants are no exception.

reviews.title: Really nice pants for the money
reviews.review_text: This is my second time ordering this style of pants and I love the light weight, fit, and comfort of this style.

reviews.title: Nice pair of pants.
reviews.review_text: I like the softness of the fabric. I would like a darker shade of black Overall, a nice pair of work pants.

reviews.title: Good if you need more room in the legs
reviews.review_text: The pants were well made. Fit at the waist but the legs were too baggy. Not like the other pants I bought in the store.

reviews.review_text: 100% cotton is major plus. i should have paid attention, "Grain" pants are cotton but not rip stop. still, they are comfortable, better for cooler days.

reviews.title: Runs small
reviews.review_text: Caught these cargo pants on sale my son likes these pants to wear to school but unfortunately they run small so I will be returning them. Material is thin and these pants don't last very long at all before they rip.

reviews.review_text: ordered 2 wrangler pants. 1 had tear in it and 2nd pair was wrongs size higher. with my luck on exchanges or returns, stuck with useless items. Thanks Walmart and Wrangler.

Pants run long . Thickness of material has declined since my last purchase. Zipper is starting to stick after two washes. there used to be a reinforced waste band what is no longer present . Overall, quality has decreased.

i like the pants they're comfortable while im working. The only issue that i had was thr delivery service they sucked big time. Next time use FedX because they're reliable .

Great price for a quality product. The pants are made well and very comfortable. Sizes are accurate and the price was fabulous. I am very pleased with the speed of shipping and the quality of the pants I ordered is outstanding.

reviews.review_text: these pants are so tight and uncomfortable I can't believe that the waist size is 52. it seems like they were made smaller. Walmart seems to be lacking in Quality clothing. I guess I will go back to buying sweat pants and shorts.

reviews.review_text: Just what I was looking for. Nothing fancy, just good cargo pants with large strong and well stitched Cargo Pockets. Good fit, and holding their color through some abuse and several washes.

reviews.review_text: I have several pairs of these cargo pants, However, this recent purchase is not the same as the ones I already have. The material is much softer and lighter. I expect they will not hold up as well.

reviews.title: Great Pants
reviews.review_text: I purchased these because of the brand name and looks. I find them confortable and they seem very durable. The cargo pockets are conveniently secured with Velcro and keep everything inside the pockets. Easy open and close. Very easy to wear them.
pants were great. This is my six pair. I ware them at work everyday. They are thin and light and great for FL. weather. No problem with shipping came when they said in good condition.

reviews.title: Like the style, not material.
reviews.review_text: The style is very nice, but the material picks up lint. If you have Black cargo, men's, with a different material I probably will buy. The ones I bought I have already taken back.

reviews.title: I love wranglers
reviews.review_text: Nice looking pants. It is hard to find Pants that fit my husband right but these are great. I bought 3 pair for him. He is very happy with them. Also they wash great. Glad we bought them.

reviews.title: Legacy Cargo - Been wearing them for years
reviews.review_text: Excellent product

reviews.title: Great fit and lots of big pockets.
reviews.review_text: I buy these for me(female) for work and home. I love the big pockets and the stretch to them. I use all of the pockets for work and home and these pants last. I sew them up if I tear them because they are easy to fix. I actually don't wear any other pants but these.

reviews.title: Size came shorter than the other color.
reviews.review_text: I bought three pants (same model, different colors) size 38, and this one specifically was tighter than the other two I compared the waist side by side, and it was shorter at least 3/4 of an inch folded, so it would be an inch and a half less waist. So not happy at all.

Wrangler is a trusted brand and while I thought I ordered the correct merchandise, I did not. However, I was able to reorder the correct merchandise. It should be here today. Hopefully, this part of cargo pants will match that sold at the local store.

reviews.title: Great pants, cheap price
reviews.review_text: I am currently in Kandahar, Afghanistan and these pants still arrived very quickly and are just what I needed. I had some more expencive pants that no longer fit so I found these for a fraction of the price. These ended up being better pants. They fit better and are of better quality. I am very happy with them.

reviews.title: cargo pants
reviews.review_text: I am a women who loves to work in the garden and when my husband stared wearing cargo pants instead of jeans I really liked all the pockets and the fit. So I looked for some cargo pants for me. What I found for women was capri cargo pants. I could not find Wrangler cargo pants for women. I did find some high dollar cargo pants for women. I wanted these pants to work in and I didn't want to pay high dollars. Wrangler are the best. So I ended up trying on Wranglers men's cargos. Luckily for me size 30 x 32 fit me. Still a little big but comfortable. I love them.

reviews.title: Disappointed but not surprised.
reviews.review_text: The cargo pockets are low for me on this style. My phone hits the top of my lower leg at the knee. So every step it hits and catches as you walk. The tech pocket is way to small to fit a modern cell phone with a case. I saw one review where that was metioned and the response was basically they can't accommodate all tech which is very reasonable however I have a pair of wrangler pants with the tech pocket on the right at my fingertips and sized large enough to not cause an issue. I would have purchased that same style again but according to everything I have found wrangler doesn't make the pair I own already. With the wrangler tags. But these pants are pants and they meet their requirements.

reviews.title: Useless.
reviews.review_text: I wish I'd realized this before ordering these pants: They're 100% cotton, so they don't have strong polyester (or other synthetic fiber) that can actually stop a rip woven into the fabric. Instead of polyester, these pants have thicker threads of regular old cotton that give the pants the look of ripstop fabric without actually having the qualities I expect from ripstop clothing. I did try them on, and the pants do look good. So, if you like the ripstop look but don't care about durability, these might be for you. But if you want durable work or outdoor pants, I'd keep looking.

reviews.title: My Favorites!
reviews.review_text: I have these Ripstop Cargo Pants in all three colors. They are my everyday wear favorites! I have been buying Wrangler for over 50 years. I think my first pair were the 11mwz jeans in the late 60s. As I have grown older, the need for more pockets has become self evident. These Cargo Pants fit the bill for casual dress, and I upgrade to the Riggs Ranger Pants for more rigorous outdoor activities. Wrangler is my jeans company!

reviews.title: Comfortable, Durable, Affordable!
reviews.review_text: True fit, very comfortable and good price for such a well made pair of pants! These are all my husband and sons wear! They really love them because they are so comfortable and do not irritate their skin! I would recommend these to everyone and especially to those who may have sensitive skin and do alot of bending and such. They are not hot like most pants and keep them cool in the summer but warm in the winter!

reviews.title: Lint magnet
reviews.review_text: I do not know but these are not the same as the ones you buy in a Walmart store. They are a lint magnet. I used like 5-6 lint roller sheets to get the lint off. They are not comfortable and will never buy these on line again. Very disappointed. If you are looking to buy these buy the ones in the Walmart store if there is one in your neighborhood.

reviews.title: NOT PERFECT, BUT CLOSE ENOUGH
reviews.review_text: Not being a big fan of Wrangler, I ordered these in desperation. Trying to find comfortable, affordable casual clothing of late has become a challenge. Especially for those of us who require larger sizing. The fit & finish of these cargo pants is good enough. Though the waist is a bit high. Were it not for that they'd truly be perfect. The material is soft, almost supple. Comfortable to wear. And lightweight. The styling is casual, understated, but good looking and durable. And that's good enough.

reviews.title: Now much lighter weight fabric than previously
reviews.review_text: They are much lighter weight pants than produced previously. I weighed the old and new versions - the new ones are about 20% lighter weight. So they're profiting both on the lower use of materials, and that you'll have to buy pants more often because they won't last as long. Up until now they've been my go-to work pant, so I'm pretty disappointed with the new light-weight versions.

reviews.title: Great pair of pants for men
reviews.review_text: My husband is a large man and fussy about his work pants and he loves these. We tried to find them in the store but they did not have his size. Ordering them on-line was easy and the size we needed was available and fit him great. These are a great pair of work pants for men, my husband is very happy with these and made me order 4 pairs!

reviews.title: comfortable and durable
reviews.review_text: My husband prefers these pants to wear to work. These pants wear pretty well, but do fray on the bottom after about a year of use. they also must be taken out of the dryer and folded right away as they will wrinkle. When Walmart first started selling these years ago the material these were made from was much heavier and the pants lasted longer. Now the material is light weight. So the pants only last about 1 year for him.

reviews.title: Great brand Great fit.
reviews.review_text: Coming from another name brand cargo pants company, I have found that these cargo pants fit well and are made better around the cargo pocket seams, especially the tops where the pockets are sewn into the pants. The other brand was always tearing and making holes around those weak points at the pockets.

reviews.title: Frayed cuffs and waist hems
reviews.review_text: The ripstop material looked well-made and of good weight. The problem, which is why I returned them, was the cuffs and the waist hems were worn and frayed. I went to a local store, which did not have the pants, but had the shorts, and the hems were not frayed. Even with today's jean style of being ripped and/or frayed, I'm pretty sure ripstop pants are not supposed to have frayed cuffs. The description doesn't say anything about a frayed style. They look like they were previously worn, but had all the new tags and labels. Very odd, but the local Walmart was great and refunded the purchase price.

reviews.title: Material alright, but not as expected.
reviews.review_text: I ordered these pants because of the cargo side pockets, but the material was not as expected. I can use them for real relax occasions, but that's all. Would not feel comfortable wearing them for other settings. I had a STROKE, so I like the fact that I can use the side pockets to hold items like, keys, credit cards, receipts, etc. Just not trill about the quality of the material.

reviews.title: good value...good fit
reviews.review_text: thinner cloth than I expected but good fit and comfortable...size 38 was exact, not too loose, not tight. 32 length spot on. Wear cargo pants for extra pockets, phone pocket takes Samsung 2 or 3 easily. Velcro works great, metal zips. For the price a good buy.

reviews.title: Not Authentic.
reviews.review_text: These pants only say Wrangler on the side pockets instead of Authentic Issue Wrangler. Further in comparison to a REAL pair of Wrangler cargo pants these pants are really thin. I wear 46s with the real deal but these knockoffs run small so to get the same fit I had to order 2 sizes up.

reviews.title: Great Work Pants
reviews.review_text: These pants are very comfortable and the material is soft. I love the tech pocket for my phone, but this ones seems a little smaller in both width and depth than the pocket in the shorts. The shorts have 2 tech pockets - one on each side where these have only one. Being black and cotton they do tend to show lint and any light dog hair you might come in contact with. The material is thin enough to be soft but thick enough to be durable. Very comparable with the Dickies cotton work pants but I think softer and more comfortable. These pants do fade some over time but not as bad as Dockers I have had. Back pockets are big enough for me to put my iPad mini in. Side cargo pockets are too but can't close the Velcro top. Careful if you get horizontal (lay down) with them as everything seems to empty out of the front pockets when you do. Transfer to the cargo pockets if your work gets you at that angle. Side note - If you use the site to store for a local store be aware that going to the back to wait for your order takes more time than just going to the store to buy it. Learned that purchasing this product.

reviews.title: Perfectly on time delivery and great product!
reviews.review_text: Delivery was right on time! (And with all the virus issues, that's a big deal!) Seem to be very good quality. Fits well. My son just started a plumbing apprenticeship, and these are his "work pants". He says they are comfortable and all the pockets are getting used!

reviews.title: Comfortable but will they hold up? Read on.
reviews.review_text: I was expecting these to be like my previous version of these pants made with heavy cotton. These are considerably a lighter cotton material, so not sure if they will hold up was well. They are comfortable to wear but maybe a tad short in the rear crotch area. I'm 6 ft and 142 Lbs. and the 31 X 32 fits almost perfect in the waist (I wear them a little lower on the top of my hips). Tucking in a light t shirt make them snug but not uncomfortable. They are almost perfect in length but an extra 1/4 to 1/2 inch longer would be ideal. It does have a convenient built in cell phone pocket on one of the side cargo pockets. Material feels smooth and comfortable.

Walmart should extend there 90 day return policy like most other retailers have. I have hardly gone out of the house the last 4 months because of Covid 19, and now I'm stuck with $40. worth of pants that don't fit. I will never buy clothing again on walmart.com!!!

reviews.title: I would buy this product again.
reviews.review_text: They fit nice and are loose enough to move. There is plenty of space for all of your daily pocket junk. I have had two pairs and the first seem to have a slightly thicker material then my current pair. Drying is excellent and the ripstop has worked flawlessly.

reviews.title: Cargo Pants cannot be found in stores
reviews.review_text: I went on the internet to order cargo pants which I could not find in several stores I visited. I found exactly what I wanted on your internet site and surprisingly, the pants arrived the next day. I could not be more pleased with my first attempt to use your site. thanks

I bought these to use as budget tactical pants and they are working very well for the intended purpose. Fit is very good, extremely comfortable and forgiving. I would highly recommend these to anyone working with in a budget. Actually like these better than my more expensive ones.

reviews.title: Not Rugged Enough For Work Pants
reviews.review_text: 38" x 32" fit was true to size on label. Comfortable but not rugged enough for work pants. I was hoping to wear these as a jean replacement but after one day of use they had a couple of small pin hole tears. Ashamed because they are so danged comfortable and have plenty of pocket space. Really like the cell phone pocket behind the left cargo pocket. These are great for casual pants but not for work. I'm not even sure they would be rugged enough for hiking.

reviews.title: Rip Stop Cargos
reviews.review_text: Love the look and feel of these pants...as a professional chef they are great for work. The size seems to run a bit large as I wear a 42x30, and these are a little baggy and long. As long as I wear my boots the length is fine. Going to buy another pair!

reviews.title: Downgrade of good pants
reviews.review_text: I bought this pants for my husband hoping to get the same as last year version. It is not the same. Design got some wierd stuff. Opening behind the cargo pocket!? Why? Need to spend 30 minutes trimming the threads all over. Poor quality pants. Will not buy again.

reviews.title: Lots of Pockets!!
reviews.review_text: I was always a Jeans and tee shirt kind of guy, but since discovering these, I really like them better. They look good, plus they have alot more pockets for those things some of us just have to carry with us. Wrangler has always been my favorite jean too.

reviews.title: I returned this item.
reviews.review_text: These hiking pants are fine. The problem is I wanted them in the light tan color and it is hard to tell from the information on the website which color would be light tan. When the pants arrived I found that they were a darker shade of tan So I had to return the items.

reviews.title: Quality has drastically lessened in last year.
reviews.review_text: I have been wearing these exact same pants (Wrangler- same Walmart item number) for last 8 years and get another every 1.5 years only when color starts to fade. reordered 4 months ago and discovered was manufactured in Mexico and quality was very good. Now made in Bangladesh and the material is thinner and had to have 2 replaced in last 4 months due to rips. The change has made quality much poorer! Only reason I still get them is that these are the only Cargos that fit me well.

reviews.title: Not true to size
reviews.review_text: Loved the fabric. I hate the new ones that stretch and have tapered legs. However, they do not run true to size. I ordered my correct size and they measured 2 inches too small. So I ordered the next size up and they still measured 2 inches smaller. Go figure.
