These jeans fit perfectly and are very comfortable thanks to the flex material. The quality feels durable and well-made, just what I expect from Wrangler. The price is very reasonable for the value, and I'm extremely happy with my purchase. Will definitely buy again.

reviews.title: Security device!
reviews.review_text: Every year I buy my husband 2 or 3 of this style jeans. He likes the relaxed fit. This year 1 pair was delivered from the local Walmart and it arrived with the security device still attached. Now I have to make a separate trip back to the store just to have the device removed. Not a big deal, but still a hassle.

I have been waiting for the holidays hoping these would go on sale. We are a Wrangler family and when I saw them in my size for only $13 a pair, I bought 4 pair. I'm a "mature" adult so comfort means more than style but at this price I get both. I am also an athletic built female who stays busy around the house so extra leg room, deeper pockets and a relaxed fit works better for me.

You have improved the delivery service. The why haven't used Walmart a lot lately because FedX services weren't very good in my area but last 2 Shipments where much better üëç I'll plan on using Walmart more. The product s have been excellent

reviews.title: A Good Fit
reviews.review_text: My son is at that weird age where he's not a youth but he's not an adult yet. so finding clothes for him is getting a little difficult. I measured them correctly and Walmart had the size I needed. Walmart was a lifesaver!
i had wanted the length at 29", but had none. In the future, I would like to be notified if that length becomes available with a waist suze at 38". Thank you!

reviews.title: Great jeans for the price
reviews.review_text: The jeans have a nice relaxed fit as described. There is less flex to the jeans than I expected, which I like. They are made of a heavy denim, and seem to be well made.
Sexy....These jeans fit real good on my husband. He looks so sexy and he told me they are very comfortable. The length, size, color and quality of these jeans are great.

Very nice pants. Looked amazing on my Husband who only ever wears his work pants. He said these are his nice pants now. The fit is very nice maybe a little big but i should have gotten him a 32 but regardless great pants for the price!!!

reviews.title: Completely mis-sized!
reviews.review_text: Wrangler certainly changed these! I reordered from a previous order, and I would swear I bought two sizes too large. These are not the same jeans that I bought a couple of years ago.

reviews.title: Best cheap jeans for fitting a big guy!
reviews.review_text: For the price on a big guy that wears his pants below the actual waist line, these fit better than any pants I've tried. Roomy, comfortable, not elastic-y. Flex is enough when bending over or down. Length is perfect.

reviews.title: GREAT value
reviews.review_text: These are the perfect choice for my work pants. The fit is comfortable and the quality is good. The VALUE is unbeatable especially since I work in the home improvement industry and beat my clothes up.
A while back I ordered two pairs of jeans 34/32. I received one 34/32 and one 44/29. The 44/29 had a hole in the knee area as well. You going to correct that error?

reviews.title: Still good jeans
reviews.review_text: These jeans are still good, but the material quality isn't what they use to be. I still love the way they fit me, and I will continue to by Wrangler brand jeans.

Too expensive rip too easy you need to go back to the original wranglers like you all used to carry they lasted a good year before ripping these pants rip and tear within days tire to spend money at Walmart for clothes that don't last

reviews.title: Great pair of jeans at a great price
reviews.review_text: Nice pair of jeans at a great price. I usually buy them when Walmart has a sale on them and then they last me more than a year easy. They just fit confortably

reviews.title: Wrangler jeans.
reviews.review_text: Having a hard time getting the size and type I want. I will not buy Levi brand. I am a Wrangler guy. I also don't like the Russler jeans by Wrangler. Don't fit right. Ride too low. Not enough flex. Not comfortable.

reviews.title: Relaxed fit but you might need a belt.
reviews.review_text: I wear a 36/34 and these jeans fit nicely, but I need to wear a belt with them. It's weird because I'm not a size 34 but a 34 would've been too small and a 38 would be a too big. Lol

reviews.title: Relaxed, fit jeans
reviews.review_text: The relaxed fit jeans arrived as advertised. Sure felt good to slip on a pair of comfortable jeans straight out the package. Lost a little bit of weight so I guess I should've stepped down in size but that's for my next order.

reviews.title: Mis-manufactured on purpose...STUPID
reviews.review_text: 2 belt loops that are supposed to be above the pockets in the back are above the pockets in the front. Ridiculous to have them there... 2nd time I've seen them this way. Nobody needs 4 belt loops in the front, 2 on each side of the button/zipper. It appears somebody changed the design without thinking. I will NOT order these again. Bye Bye Wrangler.

reviews.title: Terrible
reviews.review_text: First the description was misleading and I got jeans that were way too tight. Then I followed the proper procedure Wrangler has to get a refund and send it back on January 3rd and still don't have my refund on the jeans I sent back. Terrible terrible service terrible terrible company I will never buy another Wrangler product again since they stole from me and did not give me my money back

reviews.title: I always buy wranglers again and again
reviews.review_text: What I love about wranglers is the diversity, if I want to spend a lot of money they have those types of jeans. If I want an every day mess around, don't care kinda jeans they have them. I wear them to the Office, to Church, to work outside because they are Wranglers!!!

reviews.title: thin material %26 sized wrong
reviews.review_text: the jeans are very thin and not what i expected from Wrangler. they might be more comfortable if they were the correct size but they're definitely labeled wrong. my fault for ordering online %26 needing them immediately or i would definitely return them. they're supposed to be a 29 length but i need to roll them twice %26 still drag on the ground- this is NOT normal. also big in the waist %26 i need to wear a belt. i bought these on a Black Friday deal. i would have been better off thrifting a pair of Levis.

Your shoppers always find my items and that's why I love the service. Drivers are awesome able helpful! Very happy that Walmart offers this service. We are very pleased with whom is picking out the items and the driver is exceptional and brings it right to the front door thank you thank you. We appreciate you.

reviews.title: Wrangler relaxed flex jeans
reviews.review_text: I ordered 2 pair of the jeans from Black Friday and when I received them one pair had a sticker outside that said 36x34 but inside the label it was a 36x30. I was very disappointed because these are nice jeans. Now I can't get the other pair for the sale price of $13.00. I am a Walmart employee. This is the first time this has happened to me.

reviews.title: A Very Satisfying Walmart Purchase!
reviews.review_text: My son isn't generally a fan of denim, but his line of work requires a durable pant that offers flexibility to bend and twist all day, while still being comfortable doing so. These Wranglers meet all of these requirements at a reasonable price. He was so satisfied, he bought five pairs! Whether he's putting in a full day at work or hitting the dance floor, these jeans can handle any bending and twisting required at either place!

reviews.title: What I've wanted; looked in-stores; found online.
reviews.review_text: Exactly what I was looking for; black Wrangler Relaxed Fit Jeans to replace my worn-out ones that, also purchased at Walmart in-store, lasted me many years. Wrangler jeans have always been my go-to comfortable and affordable jeans. I'm glad they are available at Walmart.com, because I could not find them in my local Walmart locations. These jeans look and fit great. The black dye is a deep black color that seems like it won't fade too fast in the wash. Time will tell.

reviews.title: More accurate sizing compared to the non-flex
reviews.review_text: First off, these 28 x 30 relaxed fit flex Wrangler jeans are sized much better compared to the 28 x 30 and 29 x 30 relaxed fit (non-flex) Wrangler jeans. The waist sizing of the non-flex versions are not even close to being correct. The 28 is a little bigger than the 29, but still a bit small. The waist of the flex version is bigger than the others and actually a bit too big, but multiple washings may take care of that. Also, the 30 length was at least 1 1/2 inches longer than specified on the non-flex version; the flex version looks pretty close to being correct. The flex fabric feels somewhat thinner than the non-flex jeans, but they are quite comfortable. We'll see how well they hold up over time. All in all, I recommend the flex relaxed fit Wrangler jeans. It's just too bad that Wrangler has such terrible quality control regarding sizing.

reviews.title: pants with flex waiste band
reviews.review_text: the web site and my mail reciept said they was flex waiste band and it lied , i got regular jeans correct size but all 3 pairs did not have flex waiste band i will not be ordering again. the store said they dont always carry these in store so i WAS going to start ordering on line but they did not send the correct pants as what the add shows and of what the receipt show. false advertisement. not

reviews.title: Not a good fit
reviews.review_text: my husband had a hard time buttoning the button first of all. And though he likes Wrangler jeans, these gave him the "plumber crack". The jeans fit below his waist, and rode down as he sat. We had a good chuckle. Not sure what was going on, as he bought his correct size, but didn't see any flexibility. Not sure about the waist?

reviews.title: High quality jeans
reviews.review_text: These jeans are great!! The relaxed fit is exactly the fit my husband was looking for. They are nice enough to wear for casual wear and sturdy enough to buy for men's work jeans. Pictured are the jeans after multiple washes and there has been zero fading. High quality jeans at a fantastic price. I will be purchasing more.

I ordered them online during a special and picked them up at Walmart in Versailles. I didn't look at them until I got home and discovered they were right. I ordered wranglers men's relaxed flex fit and got one flex fit but not two. I took them to Walmart in Jefferson City to exchange them. She said she would refund what I paid for them. I said no..I just want to get the exact pair of men's jeans only with the flex. She said we don't do exchanges so you will have to pay full price for the next pair. I went to get another pair and they were out of stock on them because the men's jeans were a mess and hadn't been straightened. The customer service person was rude and didn't care that it wasn't my fault for needing an exchange and the sign on the wall said we do refunds or exchanges! Very disappointed!

reviews.title: My New Go-To Jeans
reviews.review_text: Have always liked Wrangler, and after getting a little older and larger, these jeans are my go to. Sizing seems consistent with other jeans I've purchased from them in the past. The stretch flex-fit is very comfortable, even lounging at home. CC folks will also appreciate the comfort of the waistband. The pockets are roomy and easy to access. The last little detail that knocks these out of the park are the belt loops. There are two betwixt the sides and back loop (4 o'clock %26 8 o'clock). Perfect position for clipping on key ring. (Size Purchased 38-29, but could have gotten away with 36-29) Hope this helps anyone on the fence about purchasing!

reviews.title: not true size
reviews.review_text: I bought these jeans online, never again. I ordered an inseam of 30". The inseam that i received was at 32" and maybe 34". I am 66 years of age, and I think I know when the inseam of my jeans are not correct. Unfortunately I can't return them. I hate freaking Walmart. You care about $$, no more.

reviews.title: Great price and a good fit with comfort.
reviews.review_text: I‚Äôm a big guy so it‚Äôs hard to find jeans that fit. Either the zipper is too short or they run tight. These are perfect. Good fit, comfortable, nice long zipper, and stretch with you when you sit. After purchasing the first pair I immediately ordered a second pair.

reviews.title: Check Size Tag Inside
reviews.review_text: ordered two pairs online delivery during black friday discount which was great. one pair was mis-sized on peel off label. returned without issue. ordered two more different style/color and again from store delivery and again one pair mis-labeled. otherwise correct size fit fine and comfortable. would buy again

reviews.title: good fit some time
reviews.review_text: went to Walmart to buy some jeans...tried on several pairs...of course they did not have my size.. My actual waist is 37.5... ended up ordering a pair of 34s. they fit perfectly... I ordered a second pair....they were an inch wider. didn't really shrink after washing. otherwise nice jeans... love the "flex" in the knees.

reviews.title: New Jean's
reviews.review_text: Great jeans for the price I was able to get them at. This was the first time I've found jeans in my size and in stock in years, so I ordered 2 pairs. The only thing I've noticed is that the material used doesn't feel as rugged as it used to but still good.

reviews.title: Size on tag compleatly wrong! No to flex fit!
reviews.review_text: 1) I hate this new trend where all pants seem to have this elastic underwear like waste ban flex-fit made into every inch of denim if any inch of a pair of jeans is even what used to be strong and durable denim. 2)This elastic trash falls apart in mear months of regular everyday use, whereas an actual single denim pair of jeans would last me 3 to 4 years on the low end, this flex fit trash hardly lasts 6 months! 3) This stuff shrinks up to nothing in the wash, then after a few days of wearing it starts falling off you again. Then if washed many times the elastic stop doing what it does and the "denim fabric" seems to get and keep the durability of wet paper. 4) Ordered what I thought was normal denim somehow got this flex fit trash but even though the tag says 44X32 (my waste is 43in) the so-called denim jeans have give of 7in in the waste?! Why?! 5) Just stop all jeans makers, stop putting this flex fit elastic trash in men's jeans! I want an actual denim pair of jeans with real denim that lasts more than 6 months. I miss the days I could buy even a cheap off-brand of denim jeans without this trash elastic flex fit made into it.

this is the 2nd time i ordered these jeans ..says delivered but never received them..i ordered 2 pairs here in texas online got 1 pair but not the other..my husband works out of state so i tried in Arkansas..same..i ordered 2 pairs says 1 pair was delivered yesterday never got it..says the 2nd pair will be delivered 2day guess we will see

reviews.title: Comfortable and better fit than regular cut jeans
reviews.review_text: I'm 6'-2" 240 lb. Regular cut jeans do not fit well, they cut me in the straddle and pull down when I bend forward, exposing butt crack. These jeans are cut full size so that they do not bind in the straddle and pull down. The fabric stretches just enough so that I am more comfortable. Wife is happy, there is less BC exposure ;-)

reviews.title: The Ultimate Manternity Jean
reviews.review_text: I call these my "manternity" jeans. They are made of Spandex, just like my wife's maternity jeans that she wore when pregnant. They stretch to accommodate as many colossal burgers or dozens of wings as I want to cram down my pie hole. And since these are the "relaxed fit" variety, they are looser in the thigh area, so I can squat in them to pick up five gallon tubs of ice cream too. Most importantly, they look like regular denim jeans, so nobody will know that you are wearing pregnant girl jeans that allow you to eat more.

reviews.title: Read labels on garments for true content info
reviews.review_text: The deacon, vintage blue, and coal black versions of these jeans are 99 percent cotton and 1 percent spandex as described here. They are great products for the price. However the dark denim (shown in my pic) and slate versions have significant polyester content (12 and 7 percent respectively) so they won't be as breathable on humid days. Same is true of at least one of the denim shorts (flex dark, not bought here). The cargo shorts I've tried are 98 percent cotton, 2 percent spandex, no polyester, which is fine. Be sure to inspect the labels sewn into the interiors of the jeans and shorts before you remove the tags and be prepared to return them if you want a true cotton/spandex blend. Five stars for the correctly labeled products, but overall rating has to be lower due to the mislabeling.

reviews.title: Not the same--I prefer ones w/ more polyester.
reviews.review_text: I bought the Dark Denim and they were perfect! So I bought the Coal Black but found the material was different (less polyester) and didn't fit as well since they had less stretch (so returned those). Another reason I preferred the ones with more polyester is that they are more resistant to dog hair. (Attached photo shows comparison of tags. See the other review "Read labels on garments for true..." for all the details on the variation in materials.

I got these for my son who is 6ft 4 he likes that the waist band has give and he can bend or stoop without feeling constricted. They are his favorite even over $80 jeans my other family member got. Not sure about how long they will last as they were a Christmas present. However, good so far and great price.

reviews.title: great pant
reviews.review_text: they fit perfect and are comfortable. I use these as work pants but end up grabbing them for casual. I work in aluminum extrusion, so they come in contact with hot parts, sharp corners and a lot of grease. they generally last about 2 years of constant wear.

reviews.title: Actual size is much bigger than what the tag says.
reviews.review_text: I've worn Wrangler Relaxed Fit jeans for years and years. I finally needed a new pair so ordered another pair of 33x32 relaxed fit online (because they didn't have that size in store), which is the same size as the ones I currently have. These jeans are much bigger in the waist than my old ones. I measured from the button, around the waist to the button hole on the new ones vs my current pairs and these new jeans are 37", 4" bigger than my old 33" jeans which measure correctly.

reviews.title: FLEX COMFORT VS STRETCH - two different things
reviews.review_text: I ordered jeans for my husband with FLEX as indicated in my order. Each time I was sent jeans with STRETCH. This is NOT FLEX. There is a label on the correct jeans that say FLEX where the STRETCH label is. I returned the first 5 pairs to the store and bought the only 2 true FLEX comfort jeans in his size. I decided to order direct from Walmart.com in hopes their personnel could pull the correct jeans. They did not. The first 2 pairs arrived and they were also NOT FLEX but STRETCH. I processed a return, and stopped at 4 Walmart stores within 65 miles of my home and was able to get only 2 more pairs of the true FLEX comfort jeans I ordered. Husband decided to keep them but to use for casual wear instead of work jeans. The 2nd order arrived and it, too, contained 2 pairs of STRETCH not FLEX comfort jeans. Husband again chose to keep them for casual jeans instead of work jeans. I'm still searching stores for his size (34wx32l) in the true FLEX comfort fit jeans.

reviews.title: Walmart Sucks
reviews.review_text: I would not recommend anything from Walmart. I went to the store with my purchase to exchange the items for a shorter size and the customer service rep said they would not honor the online price. I had to return them and pay $12 more for the same items I didn't want my money back I just wanted the right size. I was told I had 7 days to exchange the item but I brought it on Black Friday and it was a Xmas gift. All other stores that I've shopped at gave you at least till the end of January this was 2 days after Christmas and you wouldn't honor the price. What kind of customer service is that especially when the front end manager tells me that the don't honored WALMART.COM prices I had to rebuy the pants at the higher price and then the rep wound up giving me the wrong ones. I never noticed that mistake till I came home. Needless to say these will be returned and I willl not make another purchase

Jeans are cheap‚Ä¶. Inexpensive they look nice when new and fit this old man well. Quality is acceptable considering the price. But they wear out quickly. Will tear easy after a while not the same quality I might have expected years ago. Again they are inexpensive. I suppose you get what you pay for. My view is inflation regulations etc‚Ä¶ have caused drop in quality. I think have a lower cost option is a blessing

Prices across the board in the United States are high due to the government's financial mismanagement of the American economy. Wal-Mart should take a page out of supply side economics which show the sales volume increase outpaces the unrealized profit that comes with increasing prices above and beyond the wholesale price merchandise product sales organizations charge.

reviews.title: Half Happy Customer
reviews.review_text: I ordered Relaxed Fit "Flex" but wrong type was sent. If I had returned it, they may not pay attention to the type of the item ordered again, then it would've been the same result. I kept it anyway to avoid the hassle of returning it. Not worth the hassle. Just frustrating!

reviews.title: Dependable clothing from a popular household name
reviews.review_text: I love the way that Wrangler incorporates different fabrics and designs into their products to suit the needs of the way we move and grow. The stretch waist in the different style pants provide comfort in my daily life. I especially love the cargo pant style because being a guy you always want to carry guy things and the cargo pants provide enough pockets for all your stuff.

reviews.title: Poor customer service
reviews.review_text: My review is of Walmarts customer service not the jeans. Husband ordered the wrong size, we ordered them on sale. WELL......Walmart no longer does exchanges, so they would have to refund to original payment method and we would have to purchase jeans again AT THE REGULR PRICE. We will shop elsewhere for his jeans from now on. BUYER BEWARE: No exchanges anymore so you can keep the good deal you may have gotten.

reviews.title: Relaxed cut jeans a little too tight in the thighs
reviews.review_text: The waist size is true to size, but the upper legs are too tight to be comfortable, especially for 'relaxed cut' jeans. Unfortunately, looser cut jeans are considered 'baggy' and are twice the price, or more, because they are classified as 'fashion' jeans

reviews.title: Do not buy these jeans
reviews.review_text: These jeans are horrible it was a wast of my money. I bought 2 pairs and they are literally falling apart from the front side I will never buy some let alone recommend them. It was a Xmas gift that I got for my son. I've only washed them like a hand full of times and both pairs are tearing!

reviews.title: Gonna try again
reviews.review_text: I love these jeans. Most comfortable jeans made....period. This is the FIRST pair I have ever ordered that ran a little short in length. I am sure it was a fluke, as I have several pairs of these jeans and haven't experienced this problem before. I've got a new pair on the way and will let you know if these run short or are true to size like all the other Wrangler jeans I own.

reviews.title: Hard to know correct size
reviews.review_text: The product is fine. I use Wrangler Jeans all the time. Ordering is tough. I am between a 40 and 42 waste with a 29 inseam. My last purchase was at a store and I got a 40-29. With the nice stretch they fit fine. When trying on Jeans this time I couldn't find a 29 inseam and all the 40 wastes seemed tight. So I went online. Worried about a 40 I went with 42. They are too large and I could maybe have done a 40. Wrangler doesn't offer free return postage so it gets pricey to return and exchange.

reviews.title: These are the best fitting most comfortable
reviews.review_text: These are the best fitting and most comfortable jeans that I have ever had. That 1% spandex is a miracle that allows the material to stretch. You should have the 1% spandex in all clothes! I would like to see it in t-shirts, polo shirts, dress shirts; underwear, and all types of pants. I bought the shorts that I use for golf that have the 1% spandex and they are my favorite golf shorts. My older man belly could use some situps and normal pants are too tight for comfort. Larger size is too bulky. The 1% spandex allows the pants to stretch to button. The fit is snug, not pulling tight as would be with normal pants. The fit is comfortable. I am cleaning out my closet of older jeans, replacing with 1 % spandex as well as all golf shorts. Make polos with 1 % spandex and I will replace mine with those. Put the 1% spandex in cotton jackets, etc. It really, really works. Give a raise to the employee that came up with the 1 % spandex; genius!!!! Thanks for making clothes comfortable! Marvin Hullinger

reviews.title: Size not correct...
reviews.review_text: I purchased size 40/28,I received something closer to 38/39 in waist. I exchanged and paid for 40/30 because i was told that an inch longer in the inseam would make the waist wider. I received the 40/30 and there was no change, but tagged as a 40/30. I have 3 other pairs of wrangler jeans all in size 40/30 and no problems in the waist and actually a little loose which is nice. One of those pairs is exactly this model jean. I don't want to upsize since then I am sure it will be too loose and unable to wear them. I have 60 days to return this item...maybe closer to 45 days, but its not worth paying to ship it back because I wouldn't break even on the return since i would be paying shipping twice. After contacting customer service and being told to buy an upsize inseam a manager should have taken the call and provided me with a free pair.

reviews.title: Great fit - not too baggy, not too skinny!
reviews.review_text: My son is very hard on his jeans. He's an athletic guy with thick muscular legs, so he doesn't like to wear skinny jeans or anything slim fit. These jeans are just right - comfortable, with room in the leg and seat for a guy with legs and a seat! The flex provides him with an even better fit. I got him these during the holidays last year, and they're still holding up. Wrangler jeans are the best.

the loose-fit jeans are really the only jeans i can wear comfortably. I had bariatric surgery 21 years ago and lost 300 lbs. Now ive got thick thighs. Any other pair of jeans are too tight and cause chaffing. But these fit great, have a decent ammount of stretch to the denim, and they last a long time as long as im not doing farm chores in them. A pair of these jeans usually lasts me about 3 years but i do have a pair that i bought new in 2018.

reviews.title: Misrepresented sizes
reviews.review_text: Very Disappointed. I purchased the same style and size in the dark denim and they fit fine. The same exact size and style in the Jet Black color do not fit around the waist. This wasnt a one-off either, 2 pair in the denim + 4 pair 6 months ago fit fine, 2 pair in the Jet Black do not fit. Poor design, poor quality control who knows, same jean only different color and they do not fit? I had to pay to return on top of that. WHAT A SHAM!

reviews.title: Be careful with inseam measurements
reviews.review_text: While I like Wrangler jeans, I have come to find that they have serious problems with the inseam measurements. I recently bought two pair of the Wrangler Five Star Premium denim Flex jeans and ordered an inseam of 32 inches. The jeans were too long, so I measured the inseam myself and found that the jeans were 34 inches. Even though the tag said they were 32 inch inseams. So be careful when you decide on the size you order!

reviews.title: Never again
reviews.review_text: I ordered two pair of jeans. Walmart sent one pair of the wrong jeans and charged me extra for not meeting the $$ dollar amount for the shipping. This is the second time I have had a problem with ordering and will NEVER use their service again. They sent a pair of straight leg jeans not relaxed fit.
I need to return them. Wrong item ordered. I have since reordered the right one. How do I return them

reviews.title: Do not buy
reviews.review_text: I do not recommend these. I wore them once to work and they ripped. They are a very thin material, not good for work pants.
I received my pants with the Anti-Theft clip still attached (both pairs). I ended up having to go to the Walmart to have them taken off!
nice jeans good quality, but you sent the wrong size, cannot use, will cost me more to return than worth the price
Terrific product, very comfortable, fits extremely well,. The jeans are true to size and length and are reasonably priced.

reviews.title: Great fit.
reviews.review_text: Pants fit very good no issues whatsoever. I look forward to using them in the fall and winter months.

reviews.title: Great for casual wear.
reviews.review_text: Runs just a little big. The elastic at the waist is very comfortable. Very happy with them as a casual day to day jean.
Excellent quality mens jeans that my boys both wear. No other brand fits as well or holds up to their teenage busyness. These jeans are worth the $$.
These are my husbands favorite jeans. They fit the best and are super comfortable with lots of shades to choose from.

reviews.title: Incorrect length
reviews.review_text: The length was not correct. It was labeled with the correct length but physically was 2 inches longer.
What I like about the jeans is the quality and the size that they come in. what I don't like is that I can't get the size that I want in the store.

reviews.title: Wrangler jeans review
reviews.review_text: Always enjoy shopping at Walmart, on-line or in-store. The Wrangler jeans for men are reasonably priced and the fit is great.

reviews.title: Rugged Relaxed Fit for the win!
reviews.review_text: These are the only jeans that I buy for work. They are true to size, durable, and have just the right amount of stretch to allow for movement.
These pants are comfortable and you knew to try on cause they can get too big for some people over all quality is wonderful tho!!!
Nice quality jean for the money. my husband has been buying this brand for past several years with no complaints.

reviews.title: Good jeans especially for the price
reviews.review_text: They fit well and are comfortable. The "flex" fabric makes it easier to move around in and gives it a better fit.
Got these for work pants for my husband. The price makes it worth it. They fit good and are comfy. He says.
Walmart you have dropped the ball the last several orders. Wrong orders and disappointing orders!!!!

reviews.title: MIA
reviews.review_text: Never received this item so a review is out of the question. I received the pair of slacks but not the jeans
good for big men have stretch seem to wear i little form just having stuff in my lockets but overall good

reviews.title: I would definitely recommend it and I would buy it again ‚ù§Ô∏è
reviews.review_text: The product feels good and the size I ordered was definitely right the material feels right and good very comfortable
I've worn Wrangler jeans my whole life. These seem very thin. After a few washes the stitching is coming out.

reviews.title: Only hellmans
reviews.review_text: This is the very best this is the very best mayonnaise they have out there. I can't compare it to any other brand.
true to size fit but husband likes em longer so they where how he likes them also very relaxed denim
These jeans were surprisingly comfortable %26 he actually liked them som so much he asked for a few more pairs.

reviews.title: Worth it!!!
reviews.review_text: Great value, good colors (we bought a few), texture. True to sizing. For twenty bucks you can't go wrong. Good return policy to boot.
The jeans have been washed 6-7 times and tet they don't fade at all. i love black jeans.if they stay black
Been buying these for years for my husband. The quality is good, which is why we keep buying them but the price keeps going up.
The pants came with a very strong chemical smell. Washing them didn't help. Still had a very strong chemical smell

reviews.review_text: Looks great on my tall husband.. great price point and colors. He has several pairs. Bought 42 x 32. True to size. He has a few of these for work and a few not for work. They go with boots or sneakers.

reviews.title: Like yoga pans for dudes.
reviews.review_text: Affordably priced, and ridiculously comfortable. I do wish they were a little heavier duty, but whatever. they're stretchy pants that look like jeans. What can I expect?

reviews.title: Wrangler Black Jeans
reviews.review_text: I work in retail and we are aloud to ware jeans. As a manager I like to be presentable and I feel the black jeans help to set that image. It also allows me the freedom of movement when I‚Äôm helping my team with projects.

reviews.title: Yes I would purchase them again
reviews.review_text: The jeans fit great and the quality of the fabric makes them handle the wear and tear that I have to do everyday. The stitching and pockets are made so you feel comfortable wearing them.

reviews.title: I wouldn't buy anything else but Wranglers
reviews.review_text: I only wear wranglers and nothing else. I love the quality and now with flex waist bands they are really comfortable and I like the 2% spandex the best

reviews.title: A little short in the crotch area
reviews.review_text: The quality of the jeans are very good overall. The fit around the waist is perfect, but I felt like they could have offered more room in the crotch area. The area between the waist and the top of the legs is a bit short for me.

reviews.title: Great jeans
reviews.review_text: My 90 year old dad wanted a new pair of jeans in a bigger waist size since he sits most of the time.. I bought and then had to return seven pairs of jeans.. thought I would try one more time and ordered off your site and they fit!!

reviews.title: Great jeans but waist cut small.
reviews.review_text: The jeans are fine but waist is cut small. Same pants in different color fits very well and waist is not cut small. I have been wearing these jeans for many years so know how they should fit. Thanks

reviews.title: true to size
reviews.review_text: I like these pants, their stylish and comfortable. Always liked levis, but they started making them sowed together in bottom and would ware a blister. These pants are different. I would buy again, great buy.

reviews.title: Great fit
reviews.review_text: I'm a big guy, big thighs, always have issues in the thigh area, i use these for work, ware house environment, so a lot of bending, squatting, and climbing, never feel like I'm going to split my pants, plus they are not super baggy ,

reviews.title: Poor quality
reviews.review_text: I have bought many wranglers over the years and been satisfied. The pants we received yesterday have a poorly sewn seam in the seat and looks bad. The pants seem not to be up to wrangler quality we‚Äôve experienced before. Disappointed!!

reviews.title: Crappy offshore sewing or poor quality control
reviews.review_text: Bought Feb 28th and the crappy sewing job one of the belt loops have already come undone a d have only wore a few times! What happened to wrangler quality. Must be from offshoring everything a now crappy product!

reviews.title: The pants are too baggy
reviews.review_text: The pants are too loose and the legs are tappered too large. The waste fits perfectly but overall, I would not have purchased them as the description was not correct.

reviews.title: Great jeans, great price
reviews.review_text: I love how these fit and feel. No sagging or pinching and the stretch gives it just a bit of give. The color is just what I like and that it is NOT fake faded and made well AND reasonable priced

reviews.title: Comfortalbe, well made
reviews.review_text: I wear these jeans mostly for work, but also off the job. The fit is very good. My only complaint is that I don't really care for the stonewash color once I got the jeans, but that's just a personal preference

reviews.title: Good value, true to size.
reviews.review_text: Husband likes them. These are the only brand he says fit well. He is a bit on the shorter size and these come in the length he needs. They are true to size and feel and look just as nice as more expensive jeans.
Super comfy. Relaxed fit is perfect for those days when you don't want super tight jeans. Baggy in the butt and thighs. Perfect jean for me. Great for work or play.

reviews.title: Great pair of jeans
reviews.review_text: My husband uses them for a work, Jean! They have a nice relaxed fit so they're very comfy all day! They wash up and dry really well and don't shrink the perfect work pants for a man!
i loved the relax fit and perfect size. the Jean material seems a little thin and easily snags and pulls fibers out. still good deal for the sale price.

reviews.title: Wranglers are the best, no matter what they cost!
reviews.review_text: For the last 25 years, after trying lots of other jeans, I have been wearing nothing but Wrangler jeans. The fit, they're comfortable, and they don't cost an arm and a leg either. I got the pair I am wearing today on sale, and that's another reason to buy them. More than anything else, I am still wearing Wranglers I bought 12 years ago, because they don't wear out like others I 've tried in the past. So-called "designer jeans" are expensive, but they're NOT worth it. Wranglers also come in several colors and styles, so there's NO reason to buy any other brand, period!

reviews.title: Oh Behave
reviews.review_text: I'm British, so not a lot fits, especially since I was cryogenically frozen. But ever since the unfreezing goo phase, I am feeling more myself. These Wrangler Jeans have given me my Mojo back, and now I have to keep telling the Ladies to behave because these Wrangler Jeans make them feel Shag-a-delic when I wear them!

reviews.title: great jeans
reviews.review_text: everything is perfect, but the only thing that I dont like is when they delivered the order dont knock my door or ring the bell, I knew the order was in my door because I have the walmart app, but the first one they just open the door and the second one they left the box in my window

reviews.title: Packaging
reviews.review_text: Two pairs of jeans were dumped at my front door, not protected in plastic or anything, spilling out of nothing less than a small Walmart shopping bag. If it had been raining, both pairs would have gotten soaked. I was at home and not notified by your driver that a package was delivered. In all of my years (am 70) of ordering online, I have never ever seen this before. I doubt I will order from Walmart again. I only did it because I am unable to get out.

reviews.title: Looks so good on my Husband
reviews.review_text: The shipping was fast. The quality is great. My husband has lost a lot of weight and he love wrangler jeans. We also ride our motorcycles and he is very comfortable. His thighs are a little on the big side and sometimes it's hard to find jeans that fit comfortably around his thighs. He love these jeans and he look so good in them. We will definitely be buying some more.

My husband loves these jeans. The relaxed fit and the waistband that has a little stretch. We have been buying them for a few years now. The material is heavy duty and they hold up well. He does a lot of bending and squatting at work other brands seemed to tear at the stress points.

reviews.title: Something is not as described.
reviews.review_text: I have purchased these many timed and they always fit and performed perfectly. I recently Ordered the Indigo, Medium Stone and a pair of Coal Black Jeans. The Indigo and Medium Stone fit perfectly as normal, and I'd give them 5 - Stars. The Coal Black on the other hand, are very tight. As all were ordered the same size and at the same time, I checked the sizing label to make sure all were as ordered. The Difference I found was the Indigo and Medium Stone called out 99% Cotton, 1% Spandex which is what the website description says whereas the Coal Black pair calls out 99% Cotton, 1% Elastane. Looking up "Elastane", it says it's another name for Spandex or Lycra. Something seems off as they don't fit. I really wanted a pair of Black Jeans comparable to fit of the blue ones but am now questioning if I was delivered the wrong pair of Coal Black Jeans or if I re-order, will they come as Cotton and Spandex or if I upsize, will I swim in them. Hate when I have to question my confidence in a product.

reviews.title: Just not for me
reviews.review_text: Slate color, I didn‚Äôt realize had the kind of lighter color stripes on them. Husband doesn‚Äôt like that, just wants regular old stonewashed jeans. He‚Äôs not a fan of stretchy jeans. Ran super large on him, so returning. Ordered the Wrangler Rustler 100% cotton jeans, and he‚Äôs happy with ‚Äújust a regular old pair of blue jeans‚Äù.

the oants fit perfectly, ive recently beaten cancer and ive lost plenty of weight these in a 30x30 fit me perfectly. a smidge long but i do enjoy a cuff in my jeans. ive bought these before and im not too hard my xlothes and got a solid year out of them before they started showing any real wear. i dont think you can beat these jeans for the price.

reviews.title: Different model, different material, different fit
reviews.review_text: I don't know why Wrangler groups these jeans together, but there are at least two different types of jeans: a) cotton/poly blend with 2% spandex, relaxed/oversized, thin fabric b) 99% cotton/1% spandex, tight/undersized, thick fabric These black jeans are type "b", which is not what I wanted. Had it not been in the grouped with the type "a", I wouldn't have bought them. Unfortunately, you can't tell from Walmart's web site, because they all show 99% cotton. It isn't until you go to Wrangler's web site and you can see the material for each one. But because Wrangler groups them together, that's probably why Walmart groups them together. And Wrangler's naming and model convention is hard to decipher, so good luck. I found that the number starting with "1097" will work on a search if you drop the beginning "10".

The wrangler jeans I purchased will definitely be returned, at more expense. I don't know if it is the Wrangler companies fault or the fact that Walmart tells companies what they will be charging for the jeans and the companies have to skimp on materials to hit the price point. From everything I have read about how much control Walmart has with suppliers, I suspect it is the latter. First, the denim is extremely lightweight, not what you expect if you have ever purchased wranglers before. Second, they cut the denim too short on the back pane of the front pockets, so the stitching and white pocket fabric pucker out no matter what - even when you're standing straight up. This was the case on both pockets for all four pair that I bought. I probably should have learned from the last time I bought Rustler jeans from Walmart. They, too, were very lightweight, they didn't have the tiny front pocket, and the insufficient number of belt loops tore out very easy as did the back pockets.

reviews.title: Good purchase
reviews.review_text: I bought them for my grandson and he's 6 foot six didn't fit, but my son is 511 and they fit him. He said they're very comfortable. He liked him. I bought them for my grandson and he's 6 foot six didn't fit, but my son is 511 and they fit him. He said they're very comfortable. He liked him.

reviews.title: Wrangler quality
reviews.review_text: The product is kind of what I was looking for but the material is definitely not what it used to be. I used to buy wranglers all the time and have them last 9 months to a year and now I'm lucky if they last 3 months. (I am rough on jeans, I work in a coal mine)

The jeans are fine besides having a weird musty smell to them that hasn't come out after 3 or 4 washes and soaking in vinegar for a bit,but I'll try soaking them for longer to see what that does. Other than that, they're the same exact jeans I always buy for work.

reviews.title: Wrong pair of jeans
reviews.review_text: I have ordered Wrangler bright color jeans size 34x34. What i have received were black Wrangler jeans size 32x30. Given that they have been delivered as an international shipment, it will not be cheap to return them by mail. Please check details of the order next time! The rest items from the order delivered OK.

reviews.title: Runs bigger or mislabeled
reviews.review_text: Overall good quality and great price. Soft and stretchy, but purchased 2 pair of 34wx32L for my husband and I feel they were mislabeled and in fact are 36 in the waist as this is what i carefully measured. I will be giving them to someone who can fit into them, too much trouble to return a $13 item.

The product is good and does not reflect your employees careless act of not filing the order with the correct items. I know the items I ordered were in stock because I returned the wrong pants and then went and pick the correct size pants I ordered off the shelf and naught them.

reviews.title: Quality jeans
reviews.review_text: It took me years to find jeans for my husband that fit properly and do not fall apart. These are the only jeans I will buy for him. He loves the comfort and the way they fit. Top of the line quality at a very fair price. I highly recommend buying these jeans.

These mens jeans , I buy as a woman because they last longer and are of better quality than WOMAN'S sizes. Substitute your hip size for the men's jean waist size. Years ago, I started buying mens instead of womans jeans because they are sturdier for ranch work.

I like the stretch material with the wrangler jeans. Unlike some fashion brands the wranglers are still relatively thick denim but allow for some give. I climb on ladders tractors mowers and trucks of all kinds every day. If i get grease oil or paint on them I dont get upset over the 20 bucks they cost.

I'm very happy with the product it just trying to get the thing picked up. It was not explained very well on your website because you had so much other stuff on it that is not relevant to picking the product up. I don't know why HR has to make everything so complicated you just need to make it very simple that everybody is a computer with especially the older generation

reviews.title: Item did not match description
reviews.review_text: I have a pair of Wrangler Jeans that fit perfectly. I've tried to order them twice through the wrangler site and both times was shipped a different product than what I thought I was ordering. Then to top it off, I'm charged an $8 return fee. I won't be ordering from wrangler again.

reviews.title: comfort & durability
reviews.review_text: I'm 65 years old & I have been wearing carpenter jeans for many years. I needed a change to something that would be a little "dressier" or acceptable for more occasions. I really like these jeans. Flexible fabric makes them comfortable, but they are also rugged enough for my active lifestyle.

reviews.title: I would definitely buy these jeans again!
reviews.review_text: The fabric is not as soft as previous Wrangler jeans I've purchased online. However, I wish these jeans were available in the "dark blue" denim color. I purchased 2 pairs of black denim jeans but would really like to have a pair in "dark blue" denim. I was really pleased with the fit of these jeans!

reviews.title: Love Wrangler Jeans!
reviews.review_text: Love Wrangler jeans!! Have always bought Wrangler jeans and NO other brand. The quality is like no other. They always fit and look great! They wash and wear very well. Never have to worry about them shrinking. The colors don't fade. Am always so pleased that they have my size and length available on line or in the store.

reviews.title: wrong size
reviews.review_text: i have been real happy with past orders always fast shipping and correct size. this order is wrong i ordered 42 30 relaxed fit 5 pairs. 2 were correct size but the other 3 are 31 30 did the person filling the order just throw the wrong size in the bag because there were no more 42-30? i am sure of it because i wanted 6 pairs and it said only 5 were available.now i have to figure out where to get a printer to print a return label and send the 3 pairs back

reviews.title: Best wearing jeans on the market
reviews.review_text: I just want to put in a word about the Wrangler relaxed fit jeans 85% cotton and 12% polyester. These are the most comfortable, best wearing jeans on the market. The fit is true to my size. The pants a not as heavy as the 100% cotton style. Not as stiff or rough feeling yet the last as long or longer than 100% cotton. They are cooler to wear in the hot summer heat also when shorts are not an option. They don't require ironing. Wash, dry, wear. Can't think of a single negative. Why make any other style?Must try this style!!

reviews.title: Good Comfort - but Only When You Choose Dark Denim
reviews.review_text: As advertised on Wrangler's store website, promising: "flex technology, giving a hint of stretch for greater freedom of movement", the Dark Denim jeans fit this description. I was surprised that two other color choices (Bleached Tint and Coal Black) have no stretch and feel like nothing more than stiff jeans. Why they're even on the same page as the Dark Denim jeans escapes me. If some of the other colors come back in stock, I don't think I would take another chance of ordering other colors that do not actually fit the description.

reviews.title: Thinner and cheaper feeling then I expected.
reviews.review_text: These jeans are ok for summer but they are very light weight and thin, NOT winter time jeans. Also the zippers feel small and cheap and hang up sometimes. They look good and are comfortable, just feel cheaper made then I expected them to be. Not bad jeans but for the price, I thought they would be a little more heavy duty.

reviews.title: Straight vs Relaxed Fit #2
reviews.review_text: I was a 30Wx32L size. Added a few pounds since my last jeans purchase, so I decided my next purchase should be 32Wx32L. I was not aware how "loose/baggy" the RELAXED FIT would be. The tags and labels have been removed and the jeans were washed, so no returns or exchanges. My Bad. Will know better next time and order the Straight/Regular size. All in all the jeans are very nice.

reviews.title: Would buy this again
reviews.review_text: It's not always easy buying clothes online because for some reason, X size with one company is not the same at another company. I needed some blue jeans that didn't cost $50 - $60 dollars or more, provided a little "give" if and when needed, and looked nice. These checked all the boxes and were a great value for the money. Would definitely recommend these to those who need a larger size.
what i liked much about these pants uis their is a stretch waist band, and it has long legs. These bark color is great, and a fabulous side leg pocket!!!

reviews.title: Think twice
reviews.review_text: After spending all the money to have shipped; the pants where way to small. Went by measurement chart. Got refund for pants but the shipping cost way more than product. Didn't get even half the shipping cost back. Think twice before buying clothes online.
They are too small and doesn't fit what it says the texture of the clothing

reviews.title: Great Slim Pants
reviews.review_text: These pants are my favorite. Very nice slim fit, and just as tough as the original 874s. They aren't slim like a skinny pant, but they are a tad bit slimmer than the classic 874, giving a nice slim look to the legs and seat. I would recommend sizing up though, the pant has a very small/short rise, and it could feel tight I. The groin if you are bigger or heavier. If very slim or skinny, you're good with regular size. I'm heavy, so I ordered a 36, instead of my usual 34, and they fit just right. Awesome pants. I do wish and hope that Dickies could add more colors to the 873 Slim line.

reviews.title: Solid, substantial and a little stylish
reviews.review_text: Solid, substantial and a little stylish trousers with slimmer legs for work. I buy these every year for my son who works at a hospital and needs sturdy pants with lots of pockets and many heavy-duty belt loops to support a belt laden with toggles and key rings. They keep a nice crease when ironed and stay black after daily wear and washing. My only wish is to have them offered in 29‚Äù inseam.

reviews.title: Everything I wear is Dickies.
reviews.review_text: Fit is perfect, waist and length. Like always Dickies run way slimmer in the waist so size up. I normally wear 34w so go to 36w when purchasing Dickies pants. 30L stops at the top of my shoes like I want in a pant. I like just a little more slimmer leg. Skateboarding pants straight fit are perfect pants.

reviews.title: Just what I wanted!
reviews.review_text: Ordered two pairs and they were both sized the same - honestly this is an improvement over past orders where some pants of the same size and cut were noticeably different. Good job. Color and shape has held up after a couple washings. I may go for a slightly lighter/softer fabric next time as these are pretty warm and I spend most of my time in an office.

reviews.title: Waist sizes.
reviews.review_text: The waist sizes do vary. I ordered a few different pairs and some were perfect fit and some much tighter.

reviews.title: Size difference
reviews.review_text: My husband swears by Dickies pants, he has worn them for 40 years. The Originals run small so he wears 36 x 32. He asked me if they sold slim fit because his pants were too baggy in the butt and legs, so I ordered slim fit in the same size. Well the waist on the slim fit are much bigger and I should've ordered a size down. I wish Dickies had sizes that were consistent.

reviews.title: Not a good fit
reviews.review_text: These pants are not true to size, and they are also inconsistent. I bought 3 pairs of the same pants - not only did none of them fit, but each of them fit differently. I don't know what happened but the quality has really fallen off.

reviews.title: Seams tearing
reviews.review_text: I bought these oants 2 weeks ago and the inside seam on the left leg, about knee level, is alreqdy starting to tear.

reviews.title: DON'T BUY THESE PANTS
reviews.review_text: I don't know who these pants are made for. The crotch is so shallow that there's no room for your junk, the thighs are so tight that moving is a chore, and the lower leg is exceptionally baggy in huge contrast to the restricting thigh area. I would have returned these had I not accidentally taken all the tags off beforehand.

reviews.title: Lady pants
reviews.review_text: The slim fit is great, just what the 874 needs. But the rise is so short! There is not enough room from the beltline to the crotch. Why did they change the rise!?

reviews.title: Great overall product
reviews.review_text: Nice fit and fair pricing. You will not find a better product for the price. Recommend cold wash and hang to dry. No fabric softener. Great product.

reviews.title: Wedgie City
reviews.review_text: No one told me that ‚Äúslim fit‚Äù meant nothing about the actual pants being any slimmer and just meant that the inseam would be 8 feet up my butt crack. Still quality pants, just wish this was more clear. Id definitely recommend if a key part of your style is to have a constant power wedgie

reviews.title: Slim fit - great idea. Low waist - not so great...
reviews.review_text: I bought two types: the regular and slim fit. I have been wearing the regular for many years and find them great for outdoor work, casual wear and even school (I am a retired teacher). They did, however, strike me as a bit baggy. This time I found a slim fit option and bought one of each (slim and reg.) to compare. I liked the "slim" aspect, but the "low waist" is definitely not for me. Any bending over produces an instant untucked shirt. How about just a "slim fit/regular waist" option?

reviews.title: Runs small
reviews.review_text: The pants are of excellent quality. I had ordered the regular and they were a bit baggy so I thought the slim would do better since I am slim but they were a little tight  around the waist and throughout, same size as the regular but they run really small. I ended up giving them away to someone who is a size smaller than me. They were a little big on him but he could wear them, I couldn't easily bend over.

reviews.title: Large at waist; No taper at waistband
reviews.review_text: Size 34 waist pants measured almost 36". Not "fitted" at waist... Like a pair of 874's with the top inch and a half cut off. I've 4-pair of 874's, (2) 33's and two with 34" waist; all fit far better at the waist than these 873 pants. I'm thin; 5'-7", 140 lbs & 33" waist. Zipper is indeed quite short. Shorter rise than 874's should work better for me since I wear pants on the hip (there's nothing else for them to hang onto). Had to alter the pants by taking up about 1.5" at the back of the waistband (after washing and drying with high heat), feathering the take-out half-way down the seat. So tailored, they now fit well. The "size up" guidance for 874's does not apply to this pair of pants.

reviews.title: Skinner leg than double knee. Very comfortable
reviews.review_text: I love these pants. I've used Dickies all my life. I always wore the double knee ones but now they are looking a little ‚ÄúHammer Pants‚Äù-y. These have just enough slack to not look like Skinny jeans. I do like the clasp closure instead of the button close. The zipper must be brand new. Kinda hard to zip up, but I make it work.

reviews.title: Fit's perfect
reviews.review_text: Love these fits perfect for work skating and going out

reviews.title: Another great purchase!
reviews.review_text: Same as always, thank goodness! Great fit, great quality. Dickies is the forest place I look when I need new pants.

reviews.title: 873 Slim Fit
reviews.review_text: Excellent quality. I already washed my pants and dried them in the dryer, and they fit perfectly. I want to congratulate the company for making these high-quality pants.

reviews.title: These pants launder beautifully after messy work
reviews.review_text: I bought these for my teenage grandson to wear on his job at a fast food kitchen. They hold up to laundering every day and come clean every time to look as good as new. I have ordered a second pair.

reviews.title: Fit big. Size down.
reviews.review_text: I order a size 32 but the waist actually measures 34" even after wash and dry. Love the pants but they're just way too big in the waist. Would recommend sizing down.

reviews.title: Dickie 873 are good quality
reviews.review_text: The Dickies 873 slim fit pants are good quality. I prefer the slim fit trim leg but those appear to be disc by Dickie.. the current version has an extra pocket on the leg which I do not want.

reviews.title: Poor Manufacturing Quality
reviews.review_text: Every Dickies work pants purchased in past 8 years have poor quality on manufacturing. So, why do I continue buying ? Dickies is good for the light duty work wear that I do, and meets minumum dress code. Usually, pants wear out within a year ( color fading, creases gone ). These 873 have same issues as always > cuffs poorly cut ( uneven, at a angle, up to 1/2" short on one side ).
Looked fine,but had to take them to Wal-Mart to exchange for correct size.

reviews.title: Great quality
reviews.review_text: These are the only pants that I wear to work very comfortable

reviews.title: The fit is not what you'd expect.
reviews.review_text: They fit VERY low on your waist. So low that I need a different size than what I normally wear. I have no idea how anyone who isn't in perfect shape can wear these, unless they make them to sit below your belly... I don't get it. Worst fitting pant I've ever tried.

reviews.title: They fit!
reviews.review_text: My husband is 6' 8‚Äù and has very skinny legs. He has bought many pairs of the regular 874 style pants, but has never been happy with how they fit. He even had them tailored to fit him better, but they still never fit quite right. These slim fit pants are exactly the right fit for him. I bought one pair for him just to try, and as soon as he put them on, I was told to buy six more pairs. He wears these every day, for work and for everything else. He is just happy to have pants that fit everywhere!

reviews.title: Worthy of a D√∫nadan
reviews.review_text: Sturdy, good fit, equally apt for holding council in Rivendell or marching into battle against the hosts of Mordor.

reviews.title: Awesome
reviews.review_text: Great quality and the fit you'd expect from Dickie

reviews.title: Maybe a little too low rise?
reviews.review_text: Absolutely no room in the crotch. I knew they were low rise but they barely made it halfway up my butt before my balls were forced back inside of me.

reviews.title: 874 work pants.
reviews.review_text: Very durable work pants . A little stiff but if you do hard rough work there fine. A few washes n your good to go.

reviews.title: Bad corporate decisions
reviews.review_text: Pants fit great. Problem is poor selection of colors and sizes. I would buy more if they had more colors that had matching shirts in my size.

reviews.title: Modern update to the classic 874s
reviews.review_text: Same classic workpants, but not as baggy as the 874's. Belt loops are bigger. Wears below the waist. A good value and well made product.

reviews.title: Pants for skateboarding
reviews.review_text: Bought these pants for skating because I figured they'd be inexpensive and durable. They proved to be just that. My knee hit pavement first session with them and they slid instead of tore. I bought another pair.

reviews.title: Inconsistent sizing
reviews.review_text: I've been a longtime fan of the Slim Taper work pants. I ordered these in the same size and they were far too small in the thighs and groin, to the point of being unwearable.

reviews.title: Great quality product!
reviews.review_text: Great value and quality! The only pants my husband will wear.

reviews.title: Perfect work pant
reviews.review_text: Durable and long lasting. I have worn this same pant for years.

reviews.title: Excellent
reviews.review_text: It fit me the way I want. I really like the fabric texture. Its high quality

reviews.title: Fits a bit odd.
reviews.review_text: Cut/measurements are a bit Strange. Fits everywhere perfect except my crotch. Which is too snug. I'm skinny 5'9‚Äù 140, recommend sizing up a size on the waist.

reviews.title: Good work pants
reviews.review_text: Good sturdy pants but fit a little loose as they have a low rise. Measure below the waist as they sit on the hips so could be different from your regular size.

reviews.title: shameful
reviews.review_text: unbelievably poor workmanship. shameful what these pants have become over the years, just shameful..

reviews.title: Pants
reviews.review_text: You should advertise that your sizes run very small. My husband wears a 29 waist and had to get 31 waist pants so they would fit. He wears 28 waist in every other pant and shorts. It would be helpful especially with dressing rooms closed at stores to know to buy bigger sizes.

reviews.title: Bring back slim tapered
reviews.review_text: Disappointed because I thought they were exactly like the slim tapered pants but I guess they no longer make those... They're just too baggy down the legs... I like the slimmer tapered leggings that way the pants don't cover the entire top of my shoes

reviews.title: Couldn't wear them but would give another shot
reviews.review_text: Great feeling pants but I couldn't wear them. I got my normal size and they were way too short in the crotch area and way too long leg length so I had to give them away. Would probably try another pair but in a store I can try different sizes on first.

reviews.title: Solid All-Purpose Pants
reviews.review_text: A good sturdy pair of work pants, and good-looking enough to wear casually. Fit is good; I opted for a 33x32 rather than my usual 32x32 based on certain other reviews suggesting they were a little too snug, but now I wish I had gone with my usual size.

reviews.title: Great pants! Be careful of sizing.
reviews.review_text: I've worn Dickies 874s for the last 15 years and never had an issue with the sizing. Each new pair was just the same as the last (I buy then six pairs at a time). I decided to try the the Slim Straight Leg pants so I ordered them in the same size (32x32) as my 874s. The Slim Straight Leg pants are about 2 inches larger in the waist and an inch longer in length compared to my 874s. I've washed and dried them multiple times in an unsuccessful attempt get them to shrink. At this point, I'm ordering another set of six in a smaller size and will donating my brand new ones to the Good Will.

reviews.title: Exceptional
reviews.review_text: Pants do exactly as they state, except that I'm a 35" waist for Dickies' pants. I have these in 34" waist, but they are too tight, so I got some one size up but now the 36" are too loose. The fastener on the pants comes undone when I tighten my belt, making it look like I forgot to button my pants. Ironically a button would fix this problem or elastic in the lining.

reviews.title: Do not know what to expect
reviews.review_text: I love the durability of Dickies but sizing is impossible to predict. I have 5 873 pants and all 5 runs different. I normally wear 32 or 33 pants. And this 873 pant I have one size 33, and 4 size 34. The first 2 I bought runs like a normal 33 and these last 2 I bought runs like a normal 34. I really don't know what size to buy. It is always a gamble.

reviews.title: Weird fit
reviews.review_text: Weirdest fitting pants I've ever had. The distance from the crotch to the waistband is super short‚Ä¶I realize these are supposed to sit below the waist, but these are ridiculous. I could barely bend my knees and they'd slide halfway down my rear. Immediately returned them.

reviews.title: Needs a button
reviews.review_text: Wish they had a button, not the cheap clasp that always comes undone when I tighten my belt

reviews.title: Short rise.
reviews.review_text: The rise was incredibly short. Was unable to wear.

reviews.title: not slim fit
reviews.review_text: these are straight leg‚Ä¶don't see how straight leg can be considered ‚Äòslim fit'

reviews.title: 873 slim fit
reviews.review_text: The zipper is just too short and makes them uncomfortable and difficult to tuck in shirt.

reviews.title: who designed this new cut? I can't wear these
reviews.review_text: Nobody is built for these. They are jammed up my crack and still sit so far beneath my waist. they just slide down

reviews.title: Great pants and great price
reviews.review_text: Great fit and comfortable for all day work Price is amazing I tried elsewhere and I still come back to these

reviews.title: Don't waste your time and money
reviews.review_text: Terrible sizing information by website. Plus, the fabric of the pants are not even close to the old ones. I have to return.

reviews.title: Not true to size
reviews.review_text: ordered a 36x30, and the dent fit.. it was more like a 30x30... It wasn't true to size, major disappointment

reviews.title: Too big
reviews.review_text: I recommend going down a size in the waist. Mine were a 32 but fit like 34. Looking into getting them exchanged

reviews.title: Size up.
reviews.review_text: I bought the grey pants. Normally I'm a 34 but these are very snug. They are stretchy everywhere except the waist? Weird. Decided to to lose 10lbs rather than return.

reviews.title: Good but
reviews.review_text: These barely have any room in the crotch area and it kills me since I wanna be comfortable skating so instead of always buying these I'd suggest you get the original 874 pants they're the same but with way more room in the crotch area

reviews.title: Durable
reviews.review_text: Long lasting pants that fit okay. The zipper is high, the bar can rub and press up against. Not so bad if you have a tucked shirt; but can irritate without. I really like the '67 fit and style. They should bring those back.

reviews.title: Size up waist
reviews.review_text: I usually get size 29/30 but with these pants, the 29 waist made the crotch super tight and uncomfortable, so I sized up to 30/30 and they now fit perfectly.

reviews.title: Unless pockets, regular fit below the knee.
reviews.review_text: Only slim on the thighs. So tight pockets are useless. Regular straight leg fit below the knee. Very poor design and look. Extremely uncomfortable. Returning the item

reviews.title: Perfect fit, lightweight un-work pant!
reviews.review_text: Team leader (or 1st victim) who tried these gave em the thumbs up for fit and comfort. "Not so heavy like the others have been" were his exact words. They looked good on him as well.

reviews.title: Happy Mom
reviews.review_text: I love the fit; however, my 12 yr old referred to them as GROWN MAN PANTS ü§£ he is 5'7 ¬Ω (130lbs) sz 31x32... I believe he's starting to like them because they fit NICE without a belt & he's not required to tuck his shirt in üôÑ

reviews.title: Good pants, good fit.
reviews.review_text: I am tall and thin. The regular work pants are just too baggy. These are fitted, but not too tight. I am a mechanic, so I do need to be able to move comfortably all day, and these do a good job of that. I like these pants.

reviews.title: Too tight for the boys
reviews.review_text: I went with the slim fit because I'm a skinny guy and figured they'd fit me best. However these pants have me permanently moose knuckling. The crotch is just way too tight. Disappointing because the pant legs are a great fit.

reviews.title: Nice work pant -Dickies quality never disappoints
reviews.review_text: I rarely find my exact size on sale items and was to get thesw pants. Dickies quality and durability has always been outstanding and these pants hold true to that. Fit is on point :)

reviews.title: Pretty all right pants
reviews.review_text: Pretty good waist fit, great leg fit, and the material is phenomenal. I don't know if I have to wash them first cuz I haven't worked in them yet, but from waist to the middle of the thigh is really tight and uncomfortable. I got the right fit and everything. Could be just need to be broken in. But they do have some uncomfortable feeling to them

reviews.title: Best pants ever
reviews.review_text: Dickies slim fit straight leg work pants are the only pants I wear period, when I‚Äôm hanging out, going out with my family, or jamming in my band they are the most comfortable pants I‚Äôve ever owned..and regular 874‚Äôs are what I wear for work..dickies all the time

reviews.title: Great work pants!
reviews.review_text: Great pair of pants. The fitment on this particular style is the one I like the most. I hope these will never be discontinued in my lifetime. I tried buying this style at the local stores in town, but they no longer carry them. I'm glad you can still order them from Dickies.

reviews.title: Opinion
reviews.review_text: I‚Äôve been wearing dickies khaki pants for many years, and have always been satisfied. In my opinion the pants 5-8 years ago were made better than today‚Äôs dickies. Stitching is less precise and more careless, causing loose strings needing to be pulled off. Overall still a good product.

reviews.title: Solid American Workmanship
reviews.review_text: I've been wearing Dickies for working around the home for decades, but I ordered directly through the company for larger color and size selections, and I am thoroughly pleased with the ongoing quality of the Dickies product as well as the rapid turnaround time in delivery. I'll be ordering again.

reviews.title: Good pair of pants
reviews.review_text: The pants are good, the cut is stylish, just wish they came in maybe a 44, 45 or 46 waist. I am still giving it a 5 star because the pants themselves are great just a little too small for me. I will say it runs small for me but it can be just right for you.

reviews.title: Good Pants
reviews.review_text: I bought these pants for everyday wear as I have multiple pairs of similar pants from dickies. Dickies pants are crazy stiff at first but after a few wears and one wash they are AMAZING; soft and durable with great fit. Disclaimer that these pants do shrink slightly when washed. The only reason I did return these and did not like them is because they were the wrong style, same size and everything, just a slightly larger opening at the bottom than the ones I perfer, the slim taper pants.

reviews.title: Slim fit work pants
reviews.review_text: I got these for my son, who works in landscaping, as a replacement for the previous pair of a now discontinued Dickies slim fit pants. I'm sure someone would like these but I doubt my son will even wear these because they are not at all like the other pair. Why are nice, comfortable 28x32 slim fit work pants so hard to find?? And why did Dickies discontinue the one pair that he could wear?

reviews.title: Happy Husband
reviews.review_text: My husband is a small man he wears a 28x32 and I never find good workpants for him. I bought him the Dickies work pant and heloves them. But he wants the heavy duty no rip work pants and you do not have them in 28x32. So we are disappointed in that. He is 61 years old and builds bridges so he works outside and over water all day long. So we would love a thicker pair of work pant in 28x32 so if you ever make them in his size he would ecstatic. Love the pants and wears them proud. If you make a thicker rugged work pant in 28x32 letmeknow asap i willby them.

reviews.title: good work pants
reviews.review_text: First bought these work pants for my husband three or four years ago. I am replacing a few pair, not because they have worn out, but because I have scrubbed one area of his present pants removing some of the color because of rubber getting on the backside from our car. These pants hold up very well and my husband is hard on clothes.

reviews.title: Best pants for your $$$!
reviews.review_text: I bought these for my son. He was in search of chocolate brown dickies. Went and called over 20 stores. Made the mistake of buying them for double the price on Amazon but I was a Mom on a mission. Didn't even think of buying them straight from the source....but eventually I did. The durability of these pants I don't see from the other big skating brands out there. I wish this style was made in more colors like olive green. I'll always continue buying these for my son. He loves them!!!

reviews.title: AWESOME WORK PANTS
reviews.review_text: I BOUGHT TWO OF THEM TO START OF MY CAREER AT ALLDATA. THEY HELD UP WELL FOR EVERYDAY USE BUT FADED IN 9 MONTHS TIME. I WASHED THEM EVERY USE WHICH WOULD BE TWICE A WEEK. I FIGURED IF GET 10 NEW ONES I CAN CUT BACKA ND THEY WOULD HAVE 4 TIMES THE LIFE. VERY STRONG AND

reviews.title: Dickies flat slim fit
reviews.review_text: I have been wearing dickies since I left the service in 1958. I love the wear of these pants and I get many compliments, asking, are those new? When I tell them they are 5 years old, they just look at me, and I must explain why they wear so well. Thank you Dickie, keep up the good work, but how about reducing the price just a little?

reviews.title: Good, but legs need to be slimmer
reviews.review_text: I loved these pants but feel that from the knee down they need to b a bit slimmer or maybe just have the overall legs a 1/2‚Äù-1‚Äù slimmer from top to bottom. Also the black pair I bought felt 2 sizes too large. If Dickies could make these into the thicker material versions of the 67 series 894s, these would probably become one of the top sellers.

reviews.title: Great Pants
reviews.review_text: Pretty much perfect. A bit shorter in the rise and trimmer all around as others have noted, but other than that, just like for favorite pair of Dickies. Please make them in more colors so I'll have a wider selection when I order another black pair.

reviews.title: Quality stylish work pants
reviews.review_text: I bought these for use at my internship where I am out on a factory floor and working in a lab all day as an engineer. I needed something more formal than jeans but just as durable. I used to wear the Original 874 at a truck wash and knew these were durable pants but wanted the slims for a better fit. They are very comfortable and fit well, except that they are low rise so tucking a shirt in the pants makes you think they should be higher making them tight in the crotch. This is only noticable putting them on in the beginning of the day and disappears once you start moving. Also after the first wash the dye on the edge of the pleat faded a lot making the pleat stand out more than usual. Bought the first pair in navy and am waiting on the second pair in chocolate brown. Works for everything I want it for just wish it was a mid rise pant to give more room.

reviews.title: Great fit. Consistent sizing.
reviews.review_text: I've been buying these pants for years. I've had dozens of them. They sometimes have different model numbers on the tag but anytime they say "slim fit straight leg work pants" they always fit exactly the same. I appreciate the consistency. They are very durable for pants that do not have reinforced knees. Good value and I'm going to continue to buy them.

reviews.title: The crotch it too small
reviews.review_text: These pants are very nice, aside from the fact that the crotch appears to be made for women or boys who say their pants. I'm not a big guy. 6'0" / 160 lbs / Slim I've never had pants give me a wedgie. I do, however, like the legs. They're perfect length. They're slim. And they fit over boots. Just the crotch... I could swear I was sent women's pants.

reviews.title: Classic and Sturdy, But Not Without Their Flaws.
reviews.review_text: These pants are great, they fit well, they are comfortable, and warm but not too warm. There's some light pilling (a surface defect of textiles caused by wear) on the thigh / crouch area already after wearing them consistently for a week (I also noted some stretching of the seems, showing the thread, but it's nothing I am worried about currently). While this may not be a sign of poor craftmanship, or materials used: I am aware of it. The front waist of the pants sits higher than I personally expected. It does ride up over my belt, which causes odd bunching, and correcting every so often. It's not terrible by any means. It may seem like I do not like these pants, but I really do love them, and the company Dickies overall. I may try a different cut next time, but these may become my "go-to" pair for a long while. Very recommended, but please keep note of my light concerns after three-ish weeks of wearing these.
