reviews.title: I love Jumbo Eye Pencils but....
reviews.review_text: I love the Jumbo Eye Pencils, but sometimes they wear down and can't be sharpened back to a semi-point (my #631 Sparkle Leopard is unusable but I refuse to throw it out). I've tried the YouTube video that suggests freezing them for 15 minutes and then sharpening them; sometimes it works and sometimes it doesn't. Any suggestions? Thank you.

reviews.title: Another shadow base option
reviews.review_text: Nice, a bit sticky when applied, best when sheered out. Yes, you can sharpen it with any large sharpener. When it's sheered ot and used as a base, there's no creasing. If you use it as a stand-alone shadow, it fades patchy and creases a lot. Use it as a shadow base. :)

reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised
reviews.review_text: Loce this purple color. It was easy to blend using my finger. I also used it as a base for some similarly colored purple eye shadow and it made tge color payoff awesome! I worried this would be oily or leave creases but it didn't. It stays exactly where you put it.

reviews.title: Jumbo eyeshadow
reviews.review_text: Fabulous, new favorite, easy to apply, doesn't crease, and lasts all day and night. I have 5 of them. Great colors, eggplant on the bottom and cupcake on the top opens up your eyes. Still waiting for the sharpener to come in, but I did find a old sharpener that works for now. I'm not as young as I used to be but with the extremely fabulous new products I look and feel 10 years younger.

reviews.title: Amazing eyeliner!!
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought this on my daughter's suggestion and love it! I have my eyes permanently done and they sometimes look very dark. I put this on the inner eye and it makes my eyes pop! It is my very favorite. Goes on smooth and lasts.long.

reviews.title: matcha is so cute
reviews.review_text: omg i love it! i got the matcha green one and it's really cute and sparkly. i have mono lids and oily skin and it stays pretty well, sometimes it mixes with my melted mascara but it's shocking since it's a crayon (i'm used to most products just smudging right off). i use it for a light eyeshadow and inner corner highlight. i do not use a base but sometimes i'll set with the nyx spray

reviews.title: Jumbo Eye Pencils are great!
reviews.review_text: I love my Jumbo Eye Pencils. They cover my eyelid very smoothly and softly, no pulling of the eyelid. There is a very good selection of colors (I would like a darker forest green added to the lighter greens available-please). I am delighted with these shadow pencils and recommend them highly.

reviews.title: JUST SHARPEN THEM!! ITS NOT THAT DIFFICULT.
reviews.review_text: People, get it together and sharpen the thing. It sharpens extremely easily (more so than a wood pencil or one of the black plastic ones like urban decay or Maybelline tattoo liner) and allows you to apply with more precision than a wide twist up. Everyone is so used to auto pencils nowadays that they can't appreciate the utility of something sharpenable. Get a good German steel sharpener and you'll never look back. Re: formula‚ÄîThey're great, just wish there were more colors (a deep red in matte and metallic would be beautiful.

reviews.title: Good smooth applying eye liner.
reviews.review_text: Some reason it's hard to find fat eyeliner pencils anymore and when you do they are over priced and not worth a hoot. This one is comparable to L.A. Colors big eye pencil. Cost a little more but I could not find the L.A.Color fat pencil so I got this one. It's soft and creamy so no tugging on delicate eye area. The color goes on super dark and rich so make sure your drawing where you want it or you'll have to redo your whole eye. It lasts all day with no touch up or raccoon eyes. It's a good eye pencil if that's what your looking for.

reviews.title: Amazing!
reviews.review_text: I use these as eyeshadow bases and on their own. Great staying power! They blend like a dream and are so versatile. For the idiots who claim they're faulty - they're not retractable. They must be sharpened with a standard large sharpener to create a point. They're staples in my collection!

reviews.title: Like the pencil, but not the amount in the pencil
reviews.review_text: I like the Jumbo eye pencil colors and how they look on my eyelids.,I am not happy with the fact it does not roll up when the color is low. It looks like there is more in the tube to roll up but it does not move. Seems like a rip off as a result paying almost nine dollars for a tip of color.

reviews.title: Terrible!!
reviews.review_text: I received this item and was excited to try it out. I was very disappointed! There is NO WAY to push the crayon out of the plastic tube, so you can only use about 1/4 inch of the entire stick. The plastic tube is full of the make-up, but you cannot get to it. Terrible design! I will NEVER buy this item again.

reviews.title: Love these eye pencils!
reviews.review_text: I have bought these eye pencils several times over the past few years and love them. I like the larger size and the colors that they come in. The price is very reasonable. I also buy the pencil sharpener which is a must to sharpen them. The only complaint I have about the sharpener is that it doesn't stay sharp for a very long time. I usually have to order a new one every 9-12 months.

reviews.title: THIS PENCIL WORKS!!
reviews.review_text: I couldn't live without this NYX MILK PENCIL. I learned years ago from watching a Beauty Show on TV that when you need to brighten up tired eyes [from my regular lack of sleep], using a white pencil to line lower eyes line would brighten your eyes. It does! However, some of these white pencils don't do a good job and barely leave any white on lower eyes -- NYX does. I use it daily.

reviews.title: good thick eye liner/shadow
reviews.review_text: this goes on easy black but not blackest black

reviews.title: Very pigmented and longevity
reviews.review_text: This eyeliner is one of the only white eyeliner that shows up and stays! Worth the money!
I haven't received this till this day. It's really disappointing

reviews.title: Never Received this item
reviews.review_text: I never received this item.

reviews.title: My go to
reviews.review_text: Last for a while. I've had mine for 4 months and use it daily. Lasts all day!
Didn't revive item. Would like one shipped to me or refunded
It was a nice color however it would not push up to expose more color

reviews.title: Color not very pigmented
reviews.review_text: Creamy application . Easy to use . Maybe try another color

reviews.title: great for the price
reviews.review_text: Plum is a perfect shade and it stays put and it stays on until I take it off.

reviews.title: Eye liner review
reviews.review_text: This is my favorite eye liner ever ‚Ä¶ love the color!!!

reviews.title: NYX Jumbo Eye Pencil
reviews.review_text: Love the green color. üíö Glides on very smoothly. Definitely would purchase again!
love the color wish i would stay on long and be as pigmented on the eyes

reviews.title: Eye crayon
reviews.review_text: Awesome product. Very sad it's not something that you can twist to refill. Will bot buy again.

reviews.title: Disappointed
reviews.review_text: Such a large tube for small amount. Does not roll up.

reviews.title: Charlie1
reviews.review_text: This stuff is awesome very creamy and the color is so stunning.

reviews.title: Disappointed
reviews.review_text: Not very well pigmented, no staying power, needs rto be applied over and over again.

reviews.title: Misleading
reviews.review_text: Deeply disappointed that this JUMBO pencil is but an inch worth of product. I would have rather spent more money to get more product from a different brand. Also, misleading packaging that looks as though it twists to push forward more product. Just beware before you buy‚Ä¶
Looked at the same or similar product elsewhere and Walmart had the items I wanted in shades I liked

reviews.title: Buy Hard Candy instead
reviews.review_text: Excellent color saturation and price. However, the amount of the "tip" is all the eyeshadow you get.

reviews.title: Raccoon eyes
reviews.review_text: It glides on without pulling on my skin BUT it doesn't stay put, it was all over my eyes after a full day of smiling.

reviews.title: Nonsense design
reviews.review_text: Nice and even application. I threw one away because I didn't realize there was more inside the shaft. I just found it needs sharpening. The new one doesn't fit any of my sharpeners. I love the liner, but may not purchase it again. I had to use a box cutter on the plastic casing.

reviews.title: Beautiful colors
reviews.review_text: I bought one in almost every color. So pretty. Great to use a quick swipe for some color on a busy day.

reviews.title: Good buy.
reviews.review_text: Love how easy it glides on and how bold the color is. You will need a powder to set it. If not, it will smear all over the place.

reviews.title: Super creamya
reviews.review_text: I love the pigment, the formula is creamy, and it stayed on a warm day when I was in the sun. All around would buy again. Also I purchased the green.

reviews.title: literally the perfect eye pencil
reviews.review_text: these are so perfect!!! and i can't wait to grab a couple more for my teens who are just starting to get into wearing a little make up

reviews.title: Really makes your eye stand out!
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Goes on very smooth. Lasts all day. Wish it was easier to sharped.

reviews.title: golden eyes
reviews.review_text: great color..easy to apply...not sure if i can turn the stick for more product to roll up bcuz bottom of tube doesn't twist

reviews.title: Jumbo eye pencil
reviews.review_text: Love the pencil but I won't buy it because it has to be sharpened poor design on a good pencil. Please change it to twist!!!!!!

reviews.title: can you say ‚Äúsharpener?‚Äù
reviews.review_text: what is it with you guys and twist up, just get a sharpener and it'll be great! My goodness, use your head. It's a great pencil. Get a sharpener.

reviews.title: Overall good product
reviews.review_text: I am on my second eye pencil and really like them. They go on easily and look great. My only concern is that they don't last long. I was hoping I could turn it and make more I of the pencil come out but there is no more.

reviews.title: Pretty color, smooth application. Not much product
reviews.review_text: Love the color and formula. Easy to apply and looks nice, but does not have much product in it. Will not last very long. If it was retractable or somehow had more on it, I'd give it 5 stars.

reviews.title: I found a replacement
reviews.review_text: This is my first purchase of this product. My regular eye crayon by another company has been discontinued. This one is a very similar quality, color and for a much better price.

reviews.title: I love these!
reviews.review_text: I love these jumbo eye pencils! I wear one of them everyday. They match my outfits and are perfect when I am on Zoom meetings. I feel like they make my eyes pop!

reviews.title: BEST THING EVER!!!
reviews.review_text: this pencil is literally so good and so cheap! I'm gonna buy like 8 more of these. the Quality is great and for the price, it comes with a good amount of highlight. It has the perfect shimmer and lasts long too! :)

reviews.title: Wish I would've ordered a different shade
reviews.review_text: I really like the idea of these eye pencils. I wish I would've ordered a different shade due to my skin tone being too light for it to show up well. It does add some shimmer, almost like a highlight, on my light skin.

reviews.title: Similar to white grease face paint that clowns use
reviews.review_text: I got this to highlight just under my brows. I am very fair skinned so I needed white. I dont know why people like this. Its similar to grease facepaint. It disappears after an hour. You cant sharpen the pencil. I found a super light concealer to use instead of this awful product.

reviews.title: Great texture but poor packaging
reviews.review_text: I would give this product a 5 star for the actual eye shadow product = smooth application, not cakey or heavy, great colour (yogurt), so quick and easy! But why can't you turn the bottom of the applicator to get more product? The design of the pencil is a one-star.

reviews.title: Obsessed!
reviews.review_text: I have been struggling for literally forever, my whole life, to find a pigmented white eyeliner! I saw that a TikTok beauty blogger used this and ran to order it! I was not disappointed! It is the only pencil I have ever found that also works on my water line. I'm sad I didn't know about this product before. Has become my favourite pencil and beauty product.

reviews.title: Super versatile and easy to use, perfect shimmer
reviews.review_text: This is such a versatile product. You can use it on your eyes, cheeks, lips, collar bone~ The formula is so smooth and feels great on the skin. The shimmer isn't overwhelming and you can build it up for a bolder look. I used it as an eyeshadow topper for a shimmery look on the lids, and on top of my lipstick so it catches the light. It's also great as a highlight, and super easy to blend.

reviews.title: So Impressed
reviews.review_text: I was bit reluctant in buying this but then picked it during this sale, So glad I did. It is the best make up product I've ever found. It is super long lasting, very pigmented, can be used as a perfect base for eyeshadows to make them even brighter and more pigmented. It is so creamy and glides effortlessly.It makes the colour pop and gives my eyes the depth effect. Cannot wait to try more colors.

reviews.title: I'm in love!
reviews.review_text: I'm in love! This product glides on the skin and doesn't scratch! it's super pigmented and gives the right glow effect! makes your skin look incredible and doesn't clump or oxidise! especially as its a multi use product I can see it benefiting a lot of people! A Highlighter, LIp Colour, Eyeshadow and the list goes on! I'm absolutely in love I now need it in ALL colours!

reviews.title: Should have checked reviews...
reviews.review_text: Yes. Sharpening is an issue. It looks like it twists up. I'm not interested in investing in yet ANOTHER company's sharpener. The hard plastic does not sharpen well, regardless. Shame on me for not being more careful. Won't purchase plastic pencils that need sharpening ever again!

reviews.title: just the tipüò≥
reviews.review_text: this is such a great eyeliner! but the whole not twisting up thing was so confusing? so i have just been using the tip and then getting another! so it has a separate purchase for a sharpener! that makes so much more sense than just the tip!!! like if the sharpener was included i would have so sharpened the plastic! but i just been using the tip and then getting another....üò≥

reviews.title: SUPER HIGHLIGHTING STICKS!!!
reviews.review_text: I love these highlighter sticks, they're easy to use and very blendable. You can also use them as eyeshadow in a pinch! I purchased them in Coconut Cake, Apple Pie and Blueberry Muffin. All are highly pigmented and long-lasting! I really enjoy using and wearing them! I'm very happy with my purchase!

reviews.title: great for inner corner
reviews.review_text: i love this product! i have been using milk for years in the inner corner and it really brightens the eye and helps dark circles. the pigmentation is great in the more vibrant shades as well. definitely a staple of mine. my only complaint would be that i find my self wanting to touch up throughout the day as it does not wear as long as i would like.

reviews.title: Plastic Version Cannot be Sharpened!
reviews.review_text: There appears to be two versions of this eye pencil ‚Äî one that can be sharpened and one that has a hard plastic casing. I assumed the bottom of the plastic casing would spin such that I could reveal more product (much like chapstick), but it doesn't ‚Äî it appears to be just for show. Could not test this until after the shrink wrap was removed. I feel very deceived and am highly disappointed!

I LOVE IT SMMM It is creamy, easy to apply, and has a really good pigment I got "milk" for highlighting, I used it for the inner corners of my eyes, nose, and a tiny bit under the brow and it works better then my powder highlighter! Definitely will buy again,

reviews.title: Can't get cap off
reviews.review_text: Honestly, I have not gotten to try it yet. The first one I bought, the lid was stuck to the pencil, and the pencil snapped in half when I used pliers to try to get it off. The second one I bought is currently having the same issue. I can't get the lid off, but I haven't snapped it in half yet.

reviews.title: Love these!
reviews.review_text: I used the Elf pencil sharpener that has a large and small sharpener and the pencil easily sharpens. There‚Äôs nothing hard about it. In fact these plastic based pencils sharpened better than the wood ones. I already bought black bean,milk and bronze. Love all of them. Don‚Äôt listen to those who say you can‚Äôt sharpen them. I use the crayon, then a power eye shadow and a setting spray and setting powder and they last throughout the day.

reviews.title: Good product but terrible packaging design
reviews.review_text: I like the formula. It‚Äôs creamy and blends well. Lasts okay, definitely wears off throughout the day. However, the packaging design is terrible. It‚Äôs plastic, but you need to sharpen it as if it‚Äôs wood. You need a special size if sharpener for it. Sharpening wastes a bunch of product. It looks like it should just twist up like with similar products from other brands, but no. I like the formula but I won‚Äôt be purchasing any more.

reviews.title: Disappointed
reviews.review_text: I love the color of this product! However, the packaging would not allow me to scroll it up or down. It was not damaged in anyway. So you're only able to use the very very little bit of exposed tip that it comes with. So disappointed to pay this much money for one or two applications.

reviews.title: Creamy pop of colour
reviews.review_text: I absolutely love the shade it's called blueberry muffin and it is a super creamy formulae with a gorgeous metallic glow I applied to my cheeks and sheered out , I like that it sheers as it gave a pop of glow and a pretty colour to the cheeks I like that the pencil doesn't need sharpening and it pushes up. This is very versatile it can be used as highlight , blush , eyeshadow and lipstick Very happy with this product

reviews.title: Great Value
reviews.review_text: I underestimated how much you get with one pencil. You can use a pencil sharpener and cut through the plastic. I bough the milk (white) to use all over my face, combining it with the sfx white makeup, to do the mad hatter for Halloween. Now I need to buy more colors for some fun eye makeup.

reviews.title: Cute Pink Color!
reviews.review_text: I love the strawberry milk color, but cannot find it. This is a cute light pink color and Im glad I ordered it. I just discovered that you CAN sharpen these pencils with a jumbo makeup crayon sharpener. Get a good sharpener and it will last way longer!

reviews.title: This is not good.
reviews.review_text: The main issue is that the color on the sight doesn't match when you put it on . It does Not go on dark at all which is why i bought it . It goes on very thin and see-through. It doesn't matter how many times you go over it . And its very oily and after blinking putting it on both eyes, it was smearing onto my upper lid . You could barely see any color at all , it was tiring just trying to put it on . I ended up wiping it off and using something else.

reviews.title: Lid unremovable, product basically disintegrated
reviews.review_text: I ordered this in 4 colours. I was only able to open 2. One I can't open at all--the lid won't come off without snapping the pencil off at the lid. Another one had the same issue, but the pencil basically collapsed in on itself when I tried to remove the lid. I've rarely seen such a poor quality product. The 2 that I was able to open are just okay.

reviews.title: Worst Eye Pencil I've Ever Purchased
reviews.review_text: I have tried this eye pencil as a waterline liner on multiple occasions and it has never worked out as hoped. It bleeds excessively and stings my eyes. It always ends up all over my under-eye and can't even last half an hour without it completely disappearing from my eye. Waste of money, and there is barley any product.

reviews.title: My favorite go to Eye Pencil!
reviews.review_text: I've tried so many eye pencils and every make-up line there is. Yes I am a make-up snob, thinking the most expensive lines must be the best. But I was wrong! NYX makes great products, including their Jumbo Eye pencil. I love the color French Fries, a beautiful deep bronze and it stays on!!! Try it!!!

reviews.title: Very pigmented
reviews.review_text: I bought the pencil in milk white and it was very pigmented and glides smoothly! I would even compare the pigmentation to that of the Makeup Forever flash palette. It is very versatile and can be used in so many ways. A must have for every makeup lover. I love using it in the inner creases of my eyes, it makes my eyes look brighter.

reviews.title: Amazing!!!
reviews.review_text: I recently purchased a jumbo pencil in the color Milk! I'am now in love. It's the most amazing thing ever..it's goes on smoothly and it's easy to smudge to get that blending things going on! As makeup artist your always searching for that perfect white pencil and that Nyx Milk pencil is by the best I've purchased! Thanks and I have so much more shopping trips to look forward with you guys!! -Amanda Glidden

reviews.title: Fresh colour
reviews.review_text: I bought the jumbo pencil in "cottage cheese". I have to admit that I hate the name but the pencil is a nice pearly whites that's a fresh alternative to matte white or nude shades when trying to open the eye. It gives a youthful awake look without looking too frosty or 90's like.

reviews.title: Creamy texture
reviews.review_text: I had never tried shadow sticks before and felt it was time to step it up. Since NYX manufactures a good quality product at a great price, I felt this was a good place to start. Of the 5 colors I purchased my favorites are Slate which I have used as a liner and in the outer corner of my eyelid for a smoky eye, and Strawberry Milk which is my absolute favorite. It is the perfect highlighter for my skin tone. My only complaint is that when I went to retrieve it from my Muji, the shadow portion had somehow separated from the stick. I don't know why or how since I immediately put it in the Muji after using it. I took a tissue and gently pressed it back where it was supposed to be and after a couple of tries it finally seemed to work. Sparkle Nude is lovely as a shadow or highlighter. The color I looked forward to trying the most was Milk. I'm still playing with this one because I haven't gotten the result I was expecting when using it to make my shadows pop. I think I may be using too much or may need to forgo the shadow base I use before Milk to get the result I'm looking for. Milk is a pretty creamy white and I can see multiple uses for it. I also got Bronze which is okay; I actually prefer the Glam Shadow Stick I got in Fard Glamour because the color seems much richer and it really glides over my eyelid. Overall I'm very happy with NYX Jumbo Eye Pencils, and would have rated it excellent had that little problem not happened.

reviews.title: Colors not "accurate"
reviews.review_text: I bought six of the blue (#606) pencils; having had them before I knew the exact color. However, I also ordered a green and lavender pencil which aren't even close to the colors on the chart. I was looking at more of a pastel shade while in actuality they are very dark. I won't return them, considering the price, but I doubt I'll use them. I sure didlike the black lacy bag they were shipped in!!

reviews.title: love it!
reviews.review_text: I am obsessed with the jumbo eye pencil in milk!! I heard so much about it prior to buying so I had high expectations safe to say I'm more than pleased with this product. I use it as a primer, an eyeshadow and use it on the inner corners. It is magic! !!

reviews.title: Very pleased with the prdocut
reviews.review_text: After the constant rave about NYX pencil in Milk I decided to buy it. It's pretty good. It's very pigmented, it goes on like butter, and it's blendable. Very nice. I'm considering buying different colors. I just got it today but I don't know how to get the rest of the product yet, like do you sharpen it, twist it? ect.

reviews.title: Not what I expected
reviews.review_text: I got the color MILK about a month ago and I have dark brown skin but I think they may have changed the formula recently, it blends into a white cast too quickly and isn't very buildable at all. I've seen it on YouTube videos and it was buildable and didn't disappear unless blended very heavily. Nice product but doesn't do what the old one did.

reviews.title: Medical use
reviews.review_text: Fun fact that your company probably doesn't even know about, is that your white eye pencils have been used as the standard for marking/ mapping clients for laser! I've used this brand specifically for nearly 10 years to map out and mark clients. Easy to use and safe for all laser :) finally ordered the actually NYX sharpener and so glad I did. Literally the only one on the market that works!

reviews.title: Milk is great for making eyes pop!
reviews.review_text: This product was recommended to me by a friend on FB. She said she used it as an eyelid primer (Milk) and it made her eyeshadows POP! I just had to try since I love bright eye colors. It works great! It just really intensifies the colors! Besides that, using it on your water line is awesome. The formula itself is smooth and doesn't budge!

reviews.title: Amazing product
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I LOVE THIS SO MUCH. I never expected for me to be so obsessed with this product I use this as a white eyeliner to make my eyes pop more as well as an eyeshadow primer to make any eyeshadow 10x more pigmented and longer lasting. I now can't live without this product I have to always have one. And the price is affordable ‚ù§Ô∏è

reviews.title: These pencils work great as shadow bases!
reviews.review_text: I have this in Milk, dark blue and brown and I love to use them over my shadow primer (by another company) when I want to do a high-impact, or richly-colored look (which is basically every day... hehe). The brown and the blue are genius to use under brown or blue powder eyeshadows, as they really help the color come through (even in a smoky look) and they don't interfere too madly with blending. They also both work AMAZINGLY under duo-chrome brown and blue powder shadows -- they really help the two-tone effect pop. Seriously, try the brown under Mac Club. Just do it. As for the Milk, I love this pencil for priming under my eyes when I want to smoke out a look (but not look like a raccoon by 5 pm), and its also a brilliant primer for those days when I'm in a rush and I don't have time to fiddle around with brushes and eyeshadow base drying times and such like that. And if I'm in an even bigger rush, I've also just swiped the brown on my lid and spread it a bit with a concealer brush (and/ or finger) and it passes well as a one-and-done shadow/ liner, too. You can't miss with these (just be sure to use a primer underneath for richest color payoff).

reviews.title: Become sheer when blended
reviews.review_text: I wanted to love these so much! I love something that I can just put on and blend out on my eyes so that it's easy. Unfortunately, the colours are beautiful but once they are blended out even a bit they become almost non-existent. There is a very sheer colour left, but I just wish it was more. And I am so confused why they aren't in twist packaging?

reviews.title: Beautiful Colored Jumbo Pencil
reviews.review_text: I own the NYX jumbo pencils is several different colors. Yes they are a little soft upon application but with a little eye primer the pigment will stay out for hours. Also great underneath NYX loose pigments for a more vibrant color payout. PS the NYX sharpener is a must!

reviews.title: Gold ~ Great Color & Value
reviews.review_text: I have this in "Gold" and really enjoy using it on its own on the lid. I get complements on how green my eyes look when I wear this shadow! Sometimes, I build the color intensely by the lash line and then blend it out with bronze shadow for a pretty effect. The name "gold" is misleading...I would consider it a warm, metallic bronze or more of an antique gold. You can wear it without a primer for 10 hours without it creasing, which is great if you have only a short time to do your makeup in the morning. I would repurchase this color, and I would be interested in buying more colors in the future!

reviews.title: It's an eyeliner
reviews.review_text: Very creamy and goes on nicely. As other reviews have said it doesn't twist up so the amount you see is all there is. Doesn't stay on for very long, as it's very creamy. I got it in black, there were few colours at the drug store, but I definitely want to get it in red. Overall it's just an eyeliner.

reviews.title: 1 of my new favorite eye makeup "go to's"!
reviews.review_text: I bought 4 shades, and now use these chubby pencils, quite often. The texture is so creamy and it glides on, with minimal tugging or pulling of the eye area. That's 1 reason that I normally don't use pencils often. These are highly pigmented, and blendable. Overall, I love these..and will be ordering multiple more shades. Plus a few fave shades, as back ups!

reviews.title: Expected more
reviews.review_text: Pros: creamy color glides on; big pencil Cons: wrong color. I asked for teal. This is tan. Also because it is so creamy after a few hours it sort of wears off into eye creases. TBH I usually use Avon glimmersticks and was looking for an alternative. I'll keep looking

reviews.title: Broke immediately or arrived broken
reviews.review_text: Either the tip was already broken or broke the second it touched my eyelid. Didn't even get to properly use it. Broken and won't work, so right in the trash. Maybe as well have thrown out money into the trash and at least not hoped for anything better! Super disappointed in this product. Expected better -- or at least expected it to not be broken immediately.

reviews.title: Blends into Skin/Applies Thin/Almost Clear
reviews.review_text: I bought the Pure Gold colour a couple months ago and have only used it twice. The warm gold colour looks great when testing it on your hand, but unfortunately it didn't apply well to my eyelids and ends up looking almost clear. This product could complement an eyeshadow for providing some subtle sparkles, but it's not really an eyeliner pencil. Too difficult to get a solid, colour-blocked line. Might be fine for others' makeup styles though!

reviews.title: Effortless, Beautiful Drama
reviews.review_text: I‚Äôve been using the Nyx Jumbo Eye Pencil for approximately 2 years and I absolutely love it. I always receive compliments when wearing it. In fact, I was at a major retail store that sells high-end makeup, and two sales ladies came up to me and asked what pencil I was wearing because they loved the way it made my eyes ‚Äúpop out‚Äù. I was more than happy to tell them it was a Nyx product.

reviews.title: "Smudge" eye liner pencil
reviews.review_text: I ordered a black eye liner. At first apply, I liked the thick line. But after a couple of hours, and in following uses, I noticed smudge marks under my eyes. I didn't apply eye liner below my eyes. I believe this liner is too oily and the quality is "cheap"!! This has happened on more than one application. I wouldn't recommend. Pay more for quality!!

reviews.title: Miracle Worker!
reviews.review_text: I bought this a month ago as a recommendation from my friend & I love it! I use the color milk under my eyeshadow & it makes the colors just pop! I use it every time I apply my eyeshadow & I can't get the same look without it. The only thing is I wish it came with more, like if you could turn the bottom & push more up like a lip balm or something because it goes really fast & it seems a waste to have that entire tube with only the little bit at the top. If you have used it quite a few times and you just want to sharpen the tip, you can't push it up far enough to get it high enough to sharpen the tip. reviews.title: But can you sharpen it?
reviews.review_text: I came here to read the reviews, thinking that I was missing something. I thought, surely there's not just a half inch of product sitting on top of a huge plastic tube, right? But, nope. It really is just a bit of product on top of a big hollow plastic tube. It just amused me that every review that mentions this fact is responded to by telling them that they can sharpen it. "Sure, it's wasteful and deceptive but did you know that you can sharpen it? because you can totally sharpen it!" Oh well. I still love Nyx and will continue to use their products.

reviews.title: More than a little disappointed
reviews.review_text: Really like the colors and array. BUT couldn't figure out how to extend the crayon. Until I started reading these reviews. Yes I will need to buy a NYX sharpener IF I decided to purchase more but when using a sharpener on plastic the life of that product is well? nil. So essentially one's cost is doubled even IF one purchased on sale. Won't buy any more.

reviews.title: Good stuff quite unfortunately packaged/designed
reviews.review_text: I like a soft chunky pencil, and was excited with the perfect eggplant color! Unfortunately, I assumed- because the pencil is clearly plastic, and the packaging is not clear at all that to GET AT the whole thing you HAVE TO SHARPEN OFF THE >PLASTIC< (whose not brilliant idea was that?)- that it would twist up. Like every other reviewer who mentions this feature, I find this design to be absolutely trash. Firstly because no one would expect this and the packaging does not clarify it, and secondly because even if you DO already own a sharpener that can manage it, you can never get the last bit out. While another reviewer gave a solution for extracting and potting the color, which is super resourceful, I actually wanted a soft-color pencil. With all the negative feedback and poor communication in the packaging, I really feel NYX should be sending people a refund or coupon for purchase price toward another product until they redesign this clear dud. On the upside, the product consistency is very versatile and the colors are great. Would welcome a "We want to make this right" action from the company! In the meantime will likely keep looking for this perfect color in another brand of twist-up pencil.

reviews.title: Beautiful colour.
reviews.review_text: It isn't a self winding pencil, so needs to be sharpened. In this day and age of too much plastic waste, that is ridiculous. It also arrived with the tip broken. Then I had to purchase a sharpener that would fit the pencil so it would be sharpened. I'd prefer to pay more so that it's self winding upwards! The 3 stars are for the colour and creaminess.

I got the color Sparkle Nude, and LOVED IT! It looked so great on my lower waterline and really made a whole look come together. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars was because the packaging was so terrible. The cap cracks so much and I had to throw it out after a couple weeks because I had nothing to keep it sealed! Love the product, but NEEDS better packaging!!!!

reviews.title: Sharpening is ridiculous!!!
reviews.review_text: I think I own just about every color and I use white on my eyes and another white on my lips. With all the colors I have I can't use them after I've worn them down. The plastic WILL NOT SHARPEN!!!! Please think about going back and looking into making it a regular fat pencil that can be sharpened or a roll up please. I don't think I will be buying anymore until something changes. ü§®‚òπÔ∏è

I like this pencil for the product. I have the color "Milk" and I love it as a highlight on my browbone and in the corners of my eyes. I am VERY fair and this pencil is so white I need to use a light hand. It's also very creamy which can be good and bad - the good being that it glides onto your skin, the not so good being that it's so creamy I wouldn't recommend wearing these on the eyelid without a primer underneath if you have oily lids because it's so soft and creamy that it does crease. Now the WORST thing: the packaging. I hate that there's plastic just under the actual product so that you can't sharpen the pencil! Some of these reviews are saying that there IS product in the shaft but why put it there unless you can get to it? NOT impressed with that at all. So, product, good. Packaging, bad.

reviews.title: Good product, terrible design. My hands hurt.
reviews.review_text: I'll admit. I love the product inside the pencil. It works well as an eyeshadow base. However, I've had this for a pretty decent amount of time but nearly never use it. Why? Because I don't have the grip strength of a Burmese python holding onto a particularly delicious rat. I don't have the power of a fully grown silverback gorilla. I cannot twist with the force and fury of a thousand supernovae. Which seems to be a requirement to use more than just the little nubbin atop the pencil itself. I know there's more product in there. I have been scouring the internet for two hours trying to find an easier way to get at the sweet goodness of Jumbo Eye Pencil. But try as I might, it eludes me. Sharpening this thing is like trying to extract Excalibur from the stone. One must have the royal lineage of Camelot to experience the privilege of applying this. Even with the advice to freeze it, to use the NYX brand dual sided sharpener, to turn it just so, and to sell my soul to the Devil himself... I can't sharpen this. The callouses I have on my hands from years of opening up soda bottles have been shredded by this seemingly innocuous eye pencil. I am sitting in tears, one eye half finished, as my mangled pencil sits in the freezer yet again in the hopes of making it accessible to me. No one else in my house has conquered the NYX Jumbo Eye Pencil, either. I know it is not just a moral failing on my part. In all seriousness, the design choice of using a smooth, semi-hard plastic instead of something like wood is, in my opinion, abysmal. I wasn't kidding about the callouses, or the fact that I am literally crying in frustration. Does anyone have any advice besides "You can use a sharpener!" because at this point I'm ready to painstakingly scrape it out and put it in a pot so I can apply it with a brush. I've learned that you can pry off the non-functional end of the pencil with pliers and push it out, so if the new sharpener I ordered doesn't work I'm gonna try that and give an update. As nice as this product is, really not worth the trouble of actually using it.

reviews.title: Jumbo Eye Pencil
reviews.review_text: This pencil is deceiving. I had to read the reviews to figure out how to get more product out of tube. It appears there are many complaints with the same issue. Why wouldn't your company make the pencil retractable? It would solve the confusion. I don't like a pencil that needs to be sharpened. won't buy this product again.

reviews.title: Product Nice - Packaging Awful
reviews.review_text: I did not know I had to buy a special sharpener for this product. Until I came on here. I have purchased two in Frosting because I liked the color. Only to find out I needed a special sharpener. I thought they would twist up. Bummer! I recommend the product because it's nice and creamy, however, skip it unless you get a special sharpener - which I did not know about and do not have. Won't buy again. :(

reviews.title: MY FAVORITE EYE PENCIL
reviews.review_text: I have used NYX eye pencils for years and love the choice of colors. After reading other reviews, it seems that people are confused about how to sharpen. These are NOT twist up pencils. They can be easily sharpened with a cosmetic sharpener which is only a few dollars.

reviews.title: DO NOT BUY‚Ä¶Waste of money and time-
reviews.review_text: Used once or twice. Nice color. Then the pencil became less pointy & shorter. Tried pliers to twist the bottom and Broke it! Then i got a chopstick and pushed it up from the bottom! It worked but the chopstick pushed through the stick. Here to try to figure out how to advance the pencil: can't be done ( must buy sharper).. As other reviewers have mentioned - a waste. Tomorrow i will try melting in the microwave. A really dump product. Won't buy again.

reviews.title: Great colours, horrible design
reviews.review_text: I love that NYX offers cruelty-free, vegan products. This jumbo pencil comes is great colours, it goes on and blends easily. I was excited to try this product, as I usually use Thrive, which is exponentially more expensive. After learning that the only way to get the product out is to sharpen the actual pencil, I have come to realize that the design is not worth saving money as it is so inconvenient. I hope that NYX will consider redesigning their eye pencils to twist for ease of use.

reviews.title: Can be sharpened!!
reviews.review_text: These jumbo sticks can be sharpened!! Use a sharpener with a dual sharpener. The large hole will work. I promise. I thought I had to throw mine away after about a week until I found a YouTube video showing that they can be sharpened. I was so excited!! Also, I am obsessed with the ‚Äúyogurt‚Äù shade.

reviews.title: Great product
reviews.review_text: Brilliant color payoff and very easy to blend! Would recommend setting with a shadow as they never set fully, but still an inexpensive and reliable color base that I've fallen in love with. I wish people wouldn't leave low reviews because they didn't realize they needed to sharpen it, the pencil works fine and you receive a lot of product if you know how to properly sharpen it. I do wish that the discontinued colors would come back, I always loved this pencil because of its wide and colorful shade range, and seeing it slim down to just bare neutrals is a little disappointing. However that's just a personal note. I would definitely recommend these :-)

reviews.title: Jumbo eye pencil disapointing
reviews.review_text: The color goes on good. I actually looked up this product page bc I was like how in the heck can you get more product from it? Thank you everyone who commented about the plastic and needing the correct sharpener. It should twist up. I don't see myself buying a separate sharpener.

reviews.title: Skin Reaction
reviews.review_text: I tend not to have skin reactions to any new makeup product. This gave me the worst skin reaction of my life. It's been weeks and my eyelids are still peeling and bleeding. The most unique and awful experience I've had with makeup. would not recommend to anyone. Threw it away.

reviews.title: My favorite eye pencil!!
reviews.review_text: I bought this 2 weeks ago and I am the happiest girl alive! This pencil is absolutely amazing and makes your eyes pop like nothing you've seen before! I love it and get so obsessed that I end up using it on a daily basis. Just look at how It looks on my waterline.. I love it so much.

I own eleven of these and they are a staple in my kit. I wear them as liner and also as shadow. When I wear it as shadow I use an NYX primer. These jumbo pencils go on so smoothly and (with primer) don't crease, transfer, smudge or fade. There's some discussion on whether you can sharpen them but I don't have any problem sharpening them.I have very sensitive skin and eyes and it has become clear to me that NYX is all I can wear. So all the make up I own is NYX. That's all you'll find in my kit.

reviews.title: Directions would have been more than helpful.
reviews.review_text: I love the way the color glides over my eyelids but I too couldn't figure out how to get a new point. Directions on the packaging would have been more than helpful. I too was twisting, turning and pushing every way. Went to the website and found out that the crayon was to be sharpened. Three turns of the sharpener did the trick but then the point fell of -[ just like a real crayon. This problem ins too bad because I really like the product.

reviews.title: White for the Waterline
reviews.review_text: A staple of my make up collection, the milky white pencil was my first ever NYX purchase. I saw on a professional make up artist's website it was a "secret" of their's to use a white eyeliner for the waterline. Well I have purchase over a dozen different white eyeliners but NOTHING compares to the NYX Jumbo eye pencil. It is gentle on the delicate waterline of the eye, creamy but stays put too. I cannot count the number of times I come back to purchase another Milky white pencil because I use it EVERY DAY to complete my natural look. I have my sister, mother, aunt and best friend in on the act too!

reviews.title: Waste of money
reviews.review_text: I love the color choices, but the fact that when the tiny tip is used up that's it. They say you can sharpen it but you can't. I was even given the suggestion to put the pencil in the freezer for a while then sharpen it, that didn't work either. I rather spend my money with another brand at least I can use all my monies worth. Shame on you NYX

reviews.title: Really bad transfer from upper water line to lower
reviews.review_text: I bought the black to smudge on my upper lash line to avoid the light skin showing underneath liner and falsies. It is very soft and goes on nicely to the skin, but it transfers really badly onto the lower lash line. Not just the lower water line, but even below where my lower lashes end. It makes a super messy look on the lower lash line. I've tried it twice, and both times I had to wipe off new smudges of black under my eye every time I went to the bathroom. Really disappointed, especially since I've seen beauty gurus use this exact product for this exact purpose.

reviews.title: Great White Pencil
reviews.review_text: I absolutely love NYX's Jumbo Eye Pencil in Milk. It is the best for highlighting the inner corner of the eye and wakes up even the most tired eyes with dark circles. It is such a simple trick, but it really makes a huge difference to your overall finished look. Will definitely be reordering! My only qualm is that I want to try the other shades but for some reason, Milk is the only shade that comes in plastic safety wrapping at the store. Not sure why this is but I would like to be assured that all NYX products are sealed so that I can be sure no one has used it as a tester and put it on their hand, eyes, or where ever else.

reviews.title: Easier to use if you depot them
reviews.review_text: Those are absolutely great! I use them as eyeshadows or to line my waterline ith a pop of colour and they don't move around at all. They also blend very well. Now, I know that a lot of people had trouble sharpening them, but I didn't even bother. They're actually creamy and soft enough that you can sorta depot them and squish them into a little jar or pot or something. I found a few tutorials on YouTube that shows you how to do it. It might be an extra step but it very easy to do and it's totally worth it.

I own almost all of these. The colors are great! The payoff is fantastic. However, they only get 3 stars because they CREASE so bad! Even with a primer. I have yet to meet one person who doesn't have creasing issues with this product. I usually apply it very thin to avoid creasing, but then I lose the color payoff. Your best bet is using a thin layer as a base for an eye shadow to improve the shadow's opacity. Hopefully, NYX will offer a water proof version of these (similar to the Maybelline color tattoos).

After 6 uses I went to sharpen it and it is not possible. The hard plastic won't be cut by a simple sharpener, and there is no way to twist it up like some pencils. I was so dumbfounded that I cut the shaft open with an exacto knife, and there IS product in the shaft, it is just unusable.

What have I been doing all of my life without Milk? It is the best make up product I've ever found. It is super long lasting, very pigmented, perfect for the waterline to open up your eyes - OR you can use it as a perfect base for eyeshadows to make them even brighter and more pigmented, and even makes them last longer. It is so creamy and spreads so evenly on the lid, NEVER creases (even without a primer) and I can't WAIT to get all the other colors! Basically, if I could marry Milk, I would.

reviews.title: Aging Eyes ‚ù§Ô∏è
reviews.review_text: I was kind of shocked by all of the negative comments. I have aging eyes so typically shadows, especially shimmers, settle into creases and move around after a few hours. I was pleasantly surprised that the shimmer wasn't overpowering, it blended well and stayed in place ALL day. I wish they came in matte colors, but that's really my only complaint.

reviews.title: Save your money
reviews.review_text: This has to be my biggest mistake yet. Pencil is so hard to work with. It doesn't roll up, what's on the tip is what you get. (Unless mine is not functioning properly). It smudges and creases. Not what I expected nor hoped for. A complete waste of money.

reviews.title: Love the eye cream but hate the container!
reviews.review_text: Only the tip of the eye pencil is accessible! Now I am supposed to buy a sharpener (almost for the same price) that will cut through the PLASTIC collar! How environmentally conscious it that! Until the company remedies this I will no longer buy any of their products.

reviews.title: Love the product
reviews.review_text: The product is great. Fun colors and easy to apply. But seriously the main complaint from most reviewers is how you get the product out when you've used it down. So why aren't you fixing that issue??!! (It can be sharpened but those directions are NOT TO BE FOUND ON THE PRODUCT) I'm sure most of us know it would cost a little more for a twist type pencil but I'm also sure most would pay the price for it.

reviews.title: Non twistable!
reviews.review_text: Was somewhat of an impulse buy, as I liked the color, however, i wish i would have passed and saved myself 5 bucks! Its kinda greasy, color transfers different from stick and it is NOT a twistable product. How the heckare you supposed to get more out? Surely there is more than the tip! Epic fail on product design.

reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for
reviews.review_text: This is a great product. Application is easy and stays in place. I've been looking for an eye shadow jumbo crayon for a long time now. Thanks NYX. The Jumbo pencil is just what I wanted. The creamy texture does not ‚Äúsettle‚Äù and feels nice on the lid, not heavy. Great for older crepe-y eyes. Super blendable while staying put on the eye. Many great colors to choose. I don't understand so many negative reviews about having to sharpen the product. It says right there, jumbo PENCIL.

reviews.title: GREAT!
reviews.review_text: AHHH this is amazing. I've never tried anything like this before but it's wonderful. Normally when I put anything glittery on my face its tends to spread everywhere. I tried it on with just some concealer underneath and it stayed on a long time. It was a nice touch to my Greek look earlier today.

reviews.title: YOU CAN TOO SHARPEN IT
reviews.review_text: So at first I was very nervous about the fact that it doesn;t twist up or anything BUT I did some research (the internet is your friend, folks) and even tho it's plastic it still sharpens just fine. YAY. Love it (milk) as a base and i even used it as a highlight on the rest of my face then just put my regular powder over it. Love it so much. I promised my hubby I was done buying makup up for a while but as soon as i save up some money for my makeup fund I will deff try out some of the other colors.

reviews.title: Please never stop making these!
reviews.review_text: So I own quite a few of these, and I never bothered reading the reviews til now‚Ä¶I am hearing a lot about the lids breaking, quick fix. The reason the lids break is from pressing the cap down to hard when closing. I like to wrap a clear piece of scotch tape around the opening of the lid a few times, prior to using them, and just be careful not to close too hard. I haven't had one break since.

reviews.title: Like it but like all the others, disappointed.
reviews.review_text: I really like this pencil but the case is now torn up due to me trying to "twist" more out using pliers. Who would have thunk that you sharpen plastic. Some directions would have been nice before I tore up the case on it. All they have to do is write sharpen with sharpener on it!

reviews.title: Good, but difficult to open and worse to sharpen.
reviews.review_text: The colors you have for the Jumbo pencils are great, however, they do start to melt while you're still wearing it. Texas heat is pretty brutal and colors soften up too much then slowly slides right into my eyes. Not to mention the plastic outer part is making my sharpener really dull so that it is not sharpening my other pencils anymore, just chewing them up. Please go back to a twist up type for the pencil.

reviews.title: Epic Fail
reviews.review_text: It is not clear at all that you require a pencil sharpener to use this product. You assume it is a twist up pencil because it is plastic (not wood), but mostly because it gives the appearance of having a twist-up bottom. Having to buy the sharpener feels like it's just a bid for more money. So now I have to go back and buy an additional product when I just wanted to try out an inexpensive item. I also don't like the idea of sharpening plastic.

reviews.title: Love the shadow, but...
reviews.review_text: I really like the shadow, I have a difficult time finding a product that does not break me out and lasts all day. This shadow produces in that department. The packaging department however needs work. I had no idea how to retrieve more of the product from the tube and had to read the reviews before I realized you have to actually sharpen the plastic itself. This is ridiculous and needs to be improved.

reviews.title: Useless after tip is gone
reviews.review_text: I bought the Milk pencil. The color is nice and it is easy to apply. However, when I went o sharpen the pencil I realized that it is made out of heavy plastic. The pencil cannot be sharpened and it is not retractable! I read some other reviews on the pencil that said once they cut open the plastic there is product inside, but I have yet to do this. If I had known that the pencil cannot be sharpened I would not have bought it.

reviews.title: Great for an eyeshadow base
reviews.review_text: I purchased Jumbo Eye Pencils in Milk & Black Bean, normally I'm not a fan of chunky eye pencils but I had heard so much about these colours that I figured for the price: it was worth a try. They are very pigmented eye pencils, they glide on very nicely. I rarely wear them on their own because of the colours I chose being a little too intense but I found much use for them as an eyeshadow base. They make any colour on top of them POP!! I also used these for Halloween & fantasy makeup. My only real negative comment is that its really not obvious that these need to be SHARPENED, they are not a twist up and it took forever to figure it out -.-.

reviews.title: Zero pigment on lighter shades
reviews.review_text: I was really excited about trying these. I ordered a light pink and a taupe brown color. I switched them on my arm first and could only see a little color with the pink. Figured surely they must look better on the eyelids, right? Nope. The only way I could tell I had anything on was from the shine on my lids. I was surprised because I usually love Nix products but these don't live up to the brand. Maybe the bright colors like green or purple come out well but if you're looking for a lighter look, don't look here.

reviews.title: Please make it retractable or something
reviews.review_text: I love the product and the color and was so excited when I discovered it. However, I felt really stupid when I couldn't figure out how to make it advance as it got too low to use. I am relieved to read the other reviews of women who felt the same way I do. I can't afford to buy it to use only a few times, so will not purchase it again unless it is made to be retractable or at least have some way to advance it and have a plastic cap over it for protection.

reviews.title: Confused. How do you use the rest of the product?!
reviews.review_text: I really like the richness of the colors and how easy they are to apply, but, I don't understand how you use the rest of the shadow once the top is finished. You can't sharpen it because the container is plastic and it doesn't turn or anything. So does that mean you only get to use that little bit at the top? I'm totally confused because if that's the case, it doessn't seem worth the money to only get a small bit of product.

Absolutely LOVE!!!! I mainly use them as a base...they have wonderful color payoff, but they do tend to crease if used mainly as an eyeshadow. And if used as a base, you'll have to put a thin layer and unfortunately...the color payoff is lost. Applied thin...it's WONDERFUL. I have gold, cobalt, milk and rust with intentions to get more! So far my fave is cobalt, I love to put it on my waterline and lower lash line and then apply a matching shadow to the lower lash line...the color stays ALL DAY!!! I just wish they had a hot pink color, lol.

reviews.title: I love these but.. .
reviews.review_text: I buy these everytime I am at the store because they are simple to us and apply smoothly. But.... they need to redesign the tube and make it a twist up. The only way I can use it is to break off the bottom and add a hot glue stick to ensure I get it all. I had to YouTube it. No real way to sharpen.

I LOVE this product!!! It is so cute!! I got iced mocha which is like a taupe color and its extremely pretty! I also got strawberry milk and that is gorgeous! I also got cottage cheese which is not very pigmented in kinda just gives you a little bit of shine rather than milk which is very white. I also got sparkle nude which is like a skin color that is very shimmery and ahhhh i love it! I also got yogurt and it looks just like the picture it is gorgeous! I love them all and i probably sound crazy but I love them! them are cream eye shadows and they r so cheap!

The texture of Jumbo Eye Pencil is slightly sticky and blendable. It works well as a primer under eyeshadow, eyeliner, or eyeshadow. Apply it lightly for a wash of color with no creasing, blending with a finger. Pacific is a cool, faded denim color. Sort of periwinkle with a metallic finish. (The square display shows a rose color which needs to be fixed on the website, but the photo of the pencil is correct). Milk is a cream white and great for enhancing eyeshadow color. Sparkle Nude is a dark champagne color, metallic finish.

reviews.title: Not the Same Color as Original Black Orchid
reviews.review_text: I'm sorry to complain about your product. I have been purchasing Black Orchid lipstick for years however, this is a completely different shade than before. If you don't have "Black Orchid" then there shouldn't be another color named the same. I bought five tubes and I am sad not to have my favorite lipstick.

reviews.title: Breeze is just beautiful
reviews.review_text: Breeze is the only shade of this line I have tried so far, but it's so nice that I've ordered two more in the same formulation. I can't get over how gorgeous the color is, and though I thought it would be far too warm for me, I'm so glad I gave it a try. The formula feels light and moisturizing, not heavy and waxy at all, but there is good color payoff. That lightness of feeling comes at the cost of having to apply a little more frequently, but that's no big deal because it only goes where you put it so this isn't a messy, slippery, bleeding-outside-the-lines stick that requires a mirror and complicated reapplication of liner and the whole nine. Breeze resembles a $20 Origins shade I used to love, and the just-right level of sheen and feeling of moisture mean I don't have to apply a gloss topcoat. It's just plain pretty. Can't believe this kind of classy shade is such a bargain buy. It's a perfect purse lippie that will go with almost everything.

reviews.title: Nice product, but matte finish just isn't for me.
reviews.review_text: Nice, but not what I was looking for. Although this is a nice lipstick and the price certainly can't be beat, the matte finish just isn't for me. I'm a senior lady in my late 60's and need a more moisturizing lipstick, more along the lines of a lip gloss with less color saturation. Otherwise, it's a nice product.

reviews.title: That was a waste...
reviews.review_text: I wanted to try a new color, so I thought, "why not go with the cheap stuff to see if I like it?" Well I shouldn't have. It smells horrid. It does NOT go on smooth at all, so I had a very difficult time getting it on even. The color was nice (I got the cherry frost), but that's about it. No clue how long it lasts since I had to wipe it off pretty quickly. Turns out the smell also means it leaves a terrible taste on my lips that I just couldn't stand. It might have only been $1, but that was a completely wasted $1. It really sucks since I've used plently of other wet n wild makeup products and haven't had such a terrible experience.
